-cR_zSbdy6OHnRWQx0IJyQ.text: I really like the mixture that I created and love the flavor that I put together in my bowl. Those guys who work at the kitchen they work hard, so I think they deserve some tips.  I noticed some of the customers were being greedy by putting so much food in their bowls and they didn't even finish it, what a waste.  Overall experience was great and yes we will comeback here again.

NKiGTeTee0ox5NTpQZNEzQ.text: Great food and service! It was my family's first time there and staff were so helpful and nice, especially Ben. It will definitely become a regular lunch place for us, it was too good to not go back!

RTjyFclPkSaUCClM4SNKPw.text: YC's is just amazing.. I make it point to come here at least once every couple of months for the last 15 years! Always meets expectations! Except one time they under cooked the meat but the manager was on it like white on rice to get it fixed!!   This place is a must try (Add extra sauce to your bowl and you will be happy!)

lzwHefJFrsd6KhewijHbRw.text: This place is so much fun! I love that you get to pack in as much veggies, meat, and noodles as you want. Then you can create a sauce combo to your liking. You take both bowls to the grill masters and they cook everything to perfection! During dinner, you can also get frozen yogurt for dessert. I'll definitely be back to try more combinations!

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

g6xYQaO2JEIFugF8zq1ZCA.text: Due to a mishap at the prep station I got soy sauce spilled all over my shirt and the floor.  Elizabeth, the manager on duty could not have been more accommodating and kind.  She brought me a YC's shirt to change into and comped our meal.  She also made sure to take special care of us during the duration of our meal. We really appreciated her attentiveness to us and her spectacular customer service.  The food was absolutely delicious, filling, healthy and enough for lunch the next day!

PCvOaWQBZ3yq01Ky6k0L-A.text: One of my favorite restaurants in the valley. The food is always so fresh and the selection allows me to change up my stir fry every visit. The staff is always friendly and helpful, especially when bringing new people with me. For $15, I can walk out of here with a full belly and lunch for tomorrow (plus the soft serve is a HUGE plus)

1qqZO5nIQcS4ITmgBicHcQ.text: Hands down one of my favorite places in the valley. Ben, the manager, is always making sure people are happy and having a great time. Food is delicious and there is plenty of it!

dpxgxU96F6YNNitIZd547A.text: This place is amazing. Good healthy eats and you can load your bowl up with whatever you love. They 100% accommodate my shellfish allergy, too! We had Ben at the grill today - he cleaned it before they put my food on to be sure that none of my food would come in contact with what I'm allergic to. Thank you, Ben! We will be back!

XPEYBGaRvLzr8RIU5HcNnQ.text: The best YC's in the valley! The staff is very kind and the manager always checks on everyone. The food line is kept spotless and fully stocked. Highly recommend!

ScVnfMT8p2QhjRWSYQi4gg.text: Super clean restaurant. All the employees consistently go above and beyond, are friendly and constantly ask if anything else is needed. Ben remembers us every time we come in. He even offered to refill our daughters drink while we ate. It is obvious that the employees love where they work, because they are always working with a smile! We will definitely be back, since this is our daughters favorite dinner spot!

iuIVl6FY7yGI4_UmjRI5mQ.text: My hubby Durrell and I have found our new favorite spot!!! Just moved here from Ohio and everyone at YC's is so friendly. Ben is our new best friend. By far one of the best employees I've met anywhere. He's so dedicated and has made our experience amazing every single time. I swear we come back just for him!!!!  The food is fresh and great and the grill cooks make it fun while you wait for your food. One time I messed up my entire bowl with a sauce on accident and they made it no problem to let me start over so I wasn't eating something I hated!!! Now that's how you win me over!!! We even got a YC t-shirt!! I love how the employees are sauce experts and can come up with any concoction you want! Ben, if you see this, keep on being you!!!!!  We love YC's!!!

8i-VC40EklP_42kUMpqJQQ.text: Wow the most ridiculous thing I've ever experienced in my whole life I went to buy my child who is 10 years old a kids meal and was refused because he was not with me !   They made me feel like a fool and basically a liar  I waited in a line that was out the door for a good four minutes and by the time I get to the counter the lady says that I have to have my child with me  I've never had that experience I just felt that it was pretty outrageous   Maria the manager was not helpful at all she said since my son was not with me she will still do it but will have to charge me a 12 year old age plate ?? But he's 10 yrs old ? I don't get it   I am a patient person & very reasonable but when you treat someone like a fool and a liar you don't get my business I'll spend my money at else where   So confusing and annoying that I will not go back to that location ever

6CZJZcmaBRilzM8PFk8gBw.text: If you are a fan of Mongolian Grill, this one is delish! Besides the typical meat, vegetable, and noodle choices, they also have a soup that is served with the food! It is spotless and clean here, and they are quick with their chop chop and don't water down the sauces, so everything has a good flavor. On the weekends there is always a car show out in the parking lot so it's a really great place to visit! Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The guy in front of us loaded his bowl this much haha!

ovgRtwhnaiyrWOr6aKojww.text: Been going here for years and I've never been disappointed. By far the best Mongolian grill, from the sauce customization, the fresh ingredients, to the clean ambiance of the whole restaurant.

1ncqJAZAHIvYWyjR1vcAWg.text: Had an amazing experience. Recently became gluten intolerant and it's a little weird going places and asking for gluten free food but when I asked the front desk girl if they gluten free items, she and another worker were so helpful and nice from start to finish. Not sure if hes manager but thank you to the man that helped me with the noodles and sauces! They even clean off the grill to cook my food and not cross contaminate. Excellent customer service and Food was delicious!

B22_5vH9eSRBuJxDt1VH7A.text: Awesome food! I love that I can make my own sauce and my niece loves to watch them make the food!

ngd4BigU64W34rcLlskDJg.text: Love YCS! I'm a vegetarian so I love being able to come here and eat a TON of vegetables. Most restaurants don't seem to have many vegetable options. Their ice cream has gotten so much tastier since the first time I came here. Most places have really crappy icy textured bad tasting ice cream.   The lady at the front with glasses was really nice and accommodating too! I'll definitely be back with a tip!

hoKm1ESYqByToP_50s9z4g.text: We are visiting from California and we weren't sure where to eat and stumbled upon this place. It was DELICIOUS and the service was EXCELLENT! It was clean, fresh, and friendly! Our kids also ate free since it was Monday! Eli was so gracious at the front and offered my husband a free meal for his birthday since it was today too! We will DEFINITELY be back due to the service and delicious food! Thank you so much!!!

ySDZ1rMfADNdrFVMZ4BMtA.text: Lots of great selections of meat and veggies. The food is excellent. The staff was super nice and very helpful with how to make the sauces. I feel it is very good value for the money. We will be going back!

Vr4j_f8vi1GrydgIgHpFPw.text: First timer on 6/22/2019 Ben was amazing !! Helped mix my sauces for me, explained the food buffet line up. Great personality with customers and his co- workers. When Ben wasn't busy greeting customers he was checking on seated customers including are table. Cooking staff and food was great. This experience will be definitely bring me back.

cXQcaCXGBY_j5wqOraeQVA.text: This place is my fave. I could buy this for life. The variety of options is great. When you first pay make sure you ask for a allergy card just in case. My girl is allergic to fish and bell peppers. Once they see it at the grill the will promptly clean it for you. The stairs is tricky but I have mine down now. 2 laddles  of 2 yc own 2 garlic 2 orange 2 ginger water it comes out great. You get a huge bowl and rice on the side. You can do soup and the drink are included with the price. I suggest lunch there it's a little cheaper and you be full all day. Thanks kris

HjSNp-qfRbsDJVBTKWLF5w.text: Love the concept of pick-your-own veggies, meats and oils/seasonings and turn it into a high protein, tasty, hot stir fry meal.  I highly suggest you follow one of the recipes posted above the stir fry area if you're unsure of which seasonings and sauces you should use.  I used quite a bit of several sauces (well, I thought it was quite a bit) and the flavor wasn't terribly strong.  But it was still very tasty.  The only draw backs for me is there is little ambiance (it feels somewhat like a cafeteria) and you will be charged a dollar for a to-go box.  I'd rather be charged an extra dime for my meal than having folks being nickle and dimed for a to-go box.  It just doesn't leave me with a good feeling to discover, after a nice meal, that I have to pay to take my leftovers home.  I believe they have no problem with folks bringing in a plastic container, though.

qbvNRGjfOn3BEReDNQ8PnQ.text: Well considering I am not a big fan of Stir fry after a very bad experience I had at a place like this a few years ago....I was skeptical about this place. My wife wanted to really try it...so we decided to visit this locale before going to the movies. I have to say for the 21.00 bucks I spent for the 2 of us I was not disappointed at all. The food was very good....the service was first class....and the meal comes with a drink and dessert as well. However do keep in mind if you decide to do the "One bowl, One trip" deal you can take your food with you....but if you do the buffet....and eat in then you cannot take anything with you. This establishment is within walking distance of the Ultrastar Cinema and a great place to get a great meal before you see your show. Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!

4PHKPULRQwQKiJKmMFnnRw.text: Nice vibe, good  protein and veggie choices and sauce options to make your stir fry your way, including the drink, soup and fro-yo what is not to like for $10.75. You will not leave here hungry and you will have plenty for leftovers. I will be back.

soeOhWMAwIW53aOJAgmZcg.text: Great place for lunch! You basically go through a line of vegetables, meats, noodles and sauces that you create yourself. At the end of the line a chef makes it on the grill in front of you. The noodle selection is great, ramen to rice noodles if you want them. You also get soup, rice and crispy noodles as sides. My hubby and I split the large bowl - which is 10.95 (this includes the drink too.) There is always enough for both. I think for kids, there is a yogurt machine too, never tried it. The restaurant is clean, the staff is friendly and the food is great - best of all, it's your creation and it's healthy. You can eat inside or out - nice place to eat before or after a movie - which is a few stores down.

X1rxVAdJmtCFZQqYzkS3-w.text: I really like this place.  The ingredients are very fresh and you can make it as healthy or unhealthy as you like.  The employees are extremely helpful and attentive.  The manager walks around and  asks if everything is to your liking.  So many choices.  I'll definitely be back!

sOIDv4JNJy8OqV7msJJ9qQ.text: You get a lot of food for the price but the restaurant is dirty and they charge you 50 cents for each to-go box.

xAvEzEwm9-pSL2EBCGw24g.text: One of my favorite places in Arizona! I come here every time I'm in Arizona!! Tons of options and love the wheat noddles!!!

F1dvLimeMoJohEYymZIxbQ.text: Best mongolian bbq In the valley. It is what you make of it. Literally.

87D41ii9fJT3NRBYnUDoAQ.text: My bff Mike and I went here for dinner one week night a few months back, and we hit the doors pretty close to closing time. So close that we thought for sure we would be turned away. BUT the sweet young lady was more than happy to have us come in! I had never been there so I wasn't really sure what to do except shove all the stuff I liked into a bowl as high as I could make it! Then when I hit the sauce bar I got a glazed look over my eyes and some nice fella just popped up asking if he could be of service. He explained that he was a sauce specialist...we talked about every sauce and he made some recommendations off of the feedback I gave and started spooning stuff into a bowl. We took it to the cook guy and he stirred and sauted my goodies until they were properly cooked and put it back in a bowl. It was really yummy! And I can't wait to go back!!! Get a doggie dish because you will need it!!

5L2WGu5SxBWviiwNunEYIA.text: I love this place!  I have been going here for years.  There is a reason why this is the only restaurant that survived in the Pavilions after all of the other restaurants, movie theater, and Best Buy were closed.    You make your own mix of meat, noodles, rice, veggies, sauce, etc. and they cook it on the wok for you.  Prices have gone up since I first started going here.  I believe dinner used to be $7.50 and now it is around $10.25 (for dinner, lunch is cheaper), but it is a lot of food.  Get a to go box for $.75, which comes out to $11.  Keep in mind this includes a drink and a huge amount of food, if you get a to go box it is enough for another meal.

PiZnlf1loN6FBqIEGjhCww.text: I gave this place a second chance. My first visit was a few weeks back (right before closing time, but was served very nicely by the hostess and a friendly cook).  Today, I was greated by a hostess. She asked what size of bowl I would like and if it was my first time. I chose the "medium" bowl (huge mistake... IT'S A LOT OF FOOD) and replied with a "yes". She walked with me and gave me tips on how to make a delicious combination.   I am a believer! I enjoyed my meal and I loved the personal touch the hostess gave to my experience.  The concept is similar to Genghis Grill (mongolian grill) with a simpler selection of proteins and vegetables, and sauces instead of condiments. They have a visible board with a list of combinations for the customers to try.   They do not serve alcohol (only reason why I would prefer Genghis Grill) over YC now, and it is fast casual (unlike Genghis where the friendly servers are always helping out customers).  Different colors and flavors for different tastes. I am glad I tried this place out.... Hope they keep up with the awesome experience I enjoyed today.

9lQXdSKpyU-qyqMnaLsuUA.text: I've been eating here since they opened! Amazing fresh veggies and great flavors. If you master filling your bowl correctly you can eat and take home even more for later. Gotta love having control over every aspect of your meal. The staff are helpful if you are a first timer, so just ask. I love love love YCs!

N2OCyvRRyDWcvh2GrtDOqg.text: Inexpensive heaps of awesome goodness.  What more can I say?  I love piling my bowl high with tons of meat, veggies and noodles then smothering it in my own concoction of sauce.  I literally can't get enough of this place and wish there were more around the valley.

PDn9vL7uxkpiKbxVrtS5sg.text: This place is overall fantastic.  Been going for over 10 years.  It is always consistently good.  Service is always great.  (employees seem to stay there for long time)  Hard to find a better, fresher, and less expensive place to eat.  Very good value for the money!

GB6kur2gxES8VxdcJ0dFug.text: I've been coming here for a few years, and have always left satisfied (and full).  Starting off with meat, there's chicken, turkey, beef, or pork (and I think there's fish at night). All four of the meats are pretty good - they're all pretty much equally good, so no real favorite.  Next comes the veggies - my plate usually consists of carrots, onions, green onions, bell peppers, and tomatoes. There are plenty of other choices that I'm not too fond of, like broccoli, tofu, bean sprouts, and several more that I can't think of.  I always go with the standard noodles, but they've also got rice noodles that look like they might be pretty good.  The sauces are pretty awesome. My usual consists of some YC's own, orange, garlic, ginger, and spicy hunan. Or if I'm in the mood, I'll go with just a straight up sweet and sour. But it's an art to make the right combination and also the right amount, so you may be safer just following the recommendations on the board.  As they prepare the dish, there's a few minutes to put together a bowl of rice, a bowl of pretty decent hot beef soup, and some chips and sweet and sour sauce, along with my drink (all of this is included in the price). By this time, your meal is probably close to ready - top the bowl off with some cilantro, and there's your meal.  I haven't tried the frozen yogurt, but I think it was pretty cheap, like a buck, so if you're in the mood for dessert, it's definitely worth it.  Overall, this place is great - you get plenty of food for your money, and it's fresh and pretty healthy.

9eQ6NPgHfqEZ_8z8FKHc-Q.text: One word: Basic. I tried Pei Wei's recently and the dish I ordered tasted just like the one I threw together at YC's. Okay, I know know that this is "Asian fusion" but that's all I am coming across in the valley. A whole bunch of "fusion" food. Give me authentic. Give me something that doesn't taste like all the chain restaurants around the area. I would have liked to have seen some baby corn, bamboo shoots and water chestnuts available as veggies to add to your dish here. In the meantime I will continue my search for good Asian cuisine around the area that doesn't taste like a microwaveable meal from the grocery store.

CkQjC_qv3MevGeCT4TY45A.text: It's hard to rate this place because a good part of the responsibility for the quality of your dish is your own.  That said, I've been to other Mongolian BBQ's and have come to realize that the restaurant's part of the responsibility is a key factor!!!  I've given this YC's many chances:  followed more than one displayed recipe, experimented with my own concoctions.  Regardless, the result of every visit is mediocre at best.  My guess is perhaps the quality of veggies (even though they look fresh, doesn't mean they taste good) the ingredients of the sauces, or the cooking method, not to mention the noodles/rice, and ambiance, is the cause for my disappointment.  I recommend Genghis Grill @ the Tempe Marketplace for a much better experience! :D

7vjhbWwha4bIIGPLQmcMBQ.text: I was so pleased with the service I received when I visited for the first time yesterday. They were all so kind and accommodating and I plan on going back MANY times.

HOrL7-zdETgEQgMpylig5g.text: This was actually my first time trying Mongolian BBQ in an actual restaurant. I've had it before at the food court in the mall and I usually love it because the flavors were always right. They have a good variety of meat, I wish they had more options for fish though! The veggies were also good, great variety. I'm a light eater so I had more veggies than meat and more fish. What got me was selecting my sauces! Too many to choose from and I had no clue what to add haha. Service was good, we had a young gentlemen check up on us which was nice because not every restaurant has a manager do that. (FYI that is a huge factor in the restaurant industry, a manager should always check on every table at least once!) But overall I had a pleasant experience here and I would definitely be back because the food was absolutely delicious, the portions, well that's really up to you on how much you shove in your bowl haha and it wasn't expensive at all! 25 dollars for two of us! You Can't beat that!

nCjuwUuAYlz03tbLoP98vA.text: I love this place. Everyone is friendly. The recipes are real easy to follow and taste fantastic. They keep it very clean considering that the key is to pile on as much as you can into your bowl. I will always choose to go here when im in the area. Always a 5 star experience.

ryqqJK6b96bqvJVhufpLag.text: This place is great. Lots of choices for you to choose- meats, non meat protein, veggies, noodles, sauces etc. everything always looks fresh and it's delish. They offer a couple different sizes and also have the option for to go which is nice. It's about $13 for the to go large size which comes with rice and a drink. Overall great price for food that is always fresh and cooked to order!

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HOu8bCQf4jdt5wK5rgItag.text: YC's is one of my fiance's and i's favorite dinner spots! So yummy and such a reasonable price with how much food you get we always go home with leftovers! Ben the manager is so nice and helpful! Definitely recommend this place to everyone and anyone.

LikHnM7uTAbXsiovbFLyTg.text: First time here enjoyed it very much. Friendly staff very helpful since it was my first time at an Mongolian grill. Fresh vegetables and wide selection of meat with a make your own sauce station. Price is an excellent value. They have a senior discount. Drunk included

VApV_CFgTm0TIeIDsWo7ig.text: My boyfriend and I have been going to YC's for many years. We love the food and the staff. I must mention two people specifically, as they always make our visits special. Ben is always welcoming and appreciative, and Andy is the master chef! We always request that Andy makes our food because he has the special touch! Thank you YC's for good food and excellent customer service!

0tg6ELzTv3UPxK4K4vbseQ.text: I've been coming here since I was in high school (about 10 years now) and I've always loved their food and everything about the place. Their prices have gone up since back then which is a bummer. I'd say it's worth it though because you can make several meals out of one bowl. The guy at the front(manager) who usually attends people coming in is so cute, personality and appearance wise. He's very charismatic and friendly and greets you with a smile and a good sense of humor. If you had to decide between any of the YCs to go to, go to this one.

PmwUN0l0JYACWQLphE1eYg.text: Oh my goodness, YC's has been a favorite of mine since I was a little girl. It used to be tradition for my dad and I to come after swim meets because i'd LOAD up on food after swimming my little booty off!   The prices have changed throughout the years but I believe now you can get a small bowl for around $12. This sounds high but my goodness, you can pack that bowl SKY HIGH so it actually ends up being enough food to fill a large bowl. You go through the line starting with meats (I'm a chicken and beef gal + don't forget to press the meat down with a piece of their thin paper so that it doesn't take up your whole bowl!), and then load up on tons of veggies, noodles, and ALL THE SAUCES. My favorite sauces are their YC's own, garlic, a little bit of peanut oil, chili oil, cooking wine, and whatever else sounds good to me that day. They have tiny bowls that you can put your sauce mixture in so that it doesn't make a mess. Because trust me, your bowl will be packed to the max and if you put the sauces over the pile, they'll run right off. Then, head over to the Mongolian grill masters where they'll grill up your bowl of goodness right in front of you!   Next, you can grab their wontons (I love dipping them in sweet and sour sauce), top your bowl with peanuts, fresh cilantro, and pineapple if you like it, and grab a bowl of rice and soup. Can you say LOADS of food?! They do charge a little extra for to-go bags but I will tell you that from my experience, it just isn't as good the next day. Some people even get it to-go from the start and just eat half there and take the rest home. Everyone has their own method to their madness. I'll be back soon, YC's!

nrBs0kekiPuyqlKLXDZQpw.text: This is a great quality Mongolian Grill, but don't come here during rush times!  First, the five star part...  Food quality is exceptional.  Everything is fresh and top quality.  They have plenty of sauces and other add-ons to get just the flavor you want.  Personally I'm all about the spices so I pile on the jalapenos, red peppers, and chile sauce.  The cooks are efficient and fast.  The pricing is a simple flat rate; choose your bowl size between small, large, and unlimited.  The drinks, rice, soups, and things like that are part of the deal.  The part that's not so great is that they are insanely packed during lunch and dinner rush, or times when there's a lot going on in the area.  It can take forever to get through the line, and then you can't reach some of the add-ons by the grills because there are so many people.  Such as my beloved jalapenos, unfortunately.

M7Smlp5eAqcGTZSfolHTtw.text: Love the food here, always good and love the Manager Ben!! He's so sweet and kind! This place has been around for years and there's a reason for it -- amazing food and great service!! If you haven't been here before it's definitely worth a trip!!!

1k8PBaK3FQ_S6-7wBdAeaw.text: This restaurant provides wonderful fresh meat and vegetables. I like the option of choosing my own sauces. They even have organic coconut aminos for a gluten-free, sugar-free option. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. If you need help with the sauces, they help you and get you information about ingredients if you need it. Ben will assist to make sure you have a pleasant dining experience.  Here I don't feel singled out because of my dietary needs. I let them know I have an allergy and they give me a sign to give to the cook who then cleans the grill before they cook my meal. It's a pleasant dining experience each time I go. And I enjoy sitting outside when the temperature is cooler.

CT1dQ1foNkQlj1U1FTRpww.text: Just stopped by for a quick lunch. Was super impressed with the quality of service and food portions. Price even included unlimited rice and soft drink. Will definitely be coming again! Can't recommend more for the money!

Enh3ho049A_X88FCN91L8A.text: This has to be one of my all time favorite places every.   I've been coming here for years and the food is amazing, and the lunch employees are always so friendly.

XA-oekgzGVC0pN9c1V3TZA.text: Been coming here for years, but finally writing a review. Come hungry and load up on the YC's own sauce.

05nKjOKJyYXXWKTt51ZdjQ.text: I was a little nervous about our visit as I haven't been there since going GF. I couldn't have been happier with the service and consideration from this team. Christy spotted us and made sure that I had GF sauce. She worried about the flavor (which was fantastic) and check in with me two or three times to ensure I was happy. She also made sure that their cook cleaned the grill for me to prevent cross contamination. Clean location and everyone was super friendly. We'll definitely be back.

9Xam48FNbJmh5fLOKH2Ahg.text: Perfect place to stop during a work lunch break.  Today, we were lucky to be helped by Suzie, Ellie and Christy.  All three of these ladies were very attentive, kind and professional.  I will certainly be coming back for more great customer service, and the food of course!

SBaMslHG2SwCz6whmXnJbQ.text: 5 stars. This place blew me away, both with their hospitality and the quality of their food.   Kim and Ben, thank you for making this a wonderful experience, and for truly making my party feel welcome. I will definitely be back!

mj-NYNDzQjvvoUFya9ERhw.text: This place is great! We went for dinner for my sister's birthday and the experience was met with friendly faces from the beginning to the end of the line! Both Suzy and Christy were super helpful, going beyond our expectations to walk us through the whole somewhat scary but surprisingly easy process! Even the manager, who clearly sets a great example, grabbed a mop and cleaned up a spill that was easy to just step over and ignore. The food was so good, made fresh in front of us! It's definitely a great place to grab a bite and hang! Keep up the great work!

pbZeh5PupcLnyPPOfDLMug.text: We had the best food tonight at this restaurant. As soon as we walked in we were greeted with the friendliest smiles!!!! The food selection is vast, they have many vegetables to choose from. They will even help you arrange your bowl from start to finish if you are unsure of what to put in it or how much. The staff at this restaurant is beyond accommodating from the food selection to the dinning experience Kelly from your staff made it the most memorable dinning experience ever We would definitely come again !

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

2n7e_YOG0lcYoay4xC96pw.text: Take tips from a former employee, from when dinner was $9 and the bowls were ceramic.  SPRING for the large bowl, when you pick up your bowl conveniently take two, it is for sauce later, you will need it. Depending on the time of day employees might enforce their one bowl rule even after you inform them it is for sauce because they have small bowls above the sauce later down the line. Those bowls are small, they are for rookies, you want a large bowl for sauce.  TO GO. Tell them your order is to go, there is no reason to pay $0.50 per box to eat there, the ambience at home with your dog is better. When they asked "do you want a soup cup?", you bet your sweet buns you want a soup cup. Even if you hate soup you want a soup cup. You have taken naps all week for dinner to be able to afford this $14 treat.  PROFILE both lanes before committing. The elderly and the young will slow you down, avoid lanes with these people. If only one lane is open ask an employee to open the other lane, it is probably closed for restocking but they can restock around you, but be empathetic and keep your trip clean because they have probably just cleaned it.  MEAT is at the beginning and you will need to grab tissue to smash it down. Meat is the enemy!! Or at least it can be. The meat is curled on purpose. It is at the beginning so that it takes up more space in your bowl - that is why it is curved. Be smarter than the dead meat. Find lots of small pieces that are flat or find curled pieces that look less frozen than others so they are easier to smash.  FLAT veggies go on first. They go around the edges, flush with the sides of your bowl leaving the middle for baby corn or potatoes and the like i.e. non-flat stuff.  BROCCOLI was public enemy number two in this race to stuff your face, but now it's your bff. Pick pieces of broccoli with long stems and put them on your tray until you have put ALL other veggies in your bowl. Only then will you place each individual piece of broccoli around the edge of your bowl like a tasty Christmas wreath. Push the stem down into the other veggies and use the head of each broccoli piece to increase the size of your bowl!! Holy Batman, Batman, that's friggin genius!  NOODLES now that your broccoli wreath has stabilized the mass of veggies in your bowl and increased stackable surface area, you are ready for noodles. TWIRL those noodles like it's mom's spaghetti and your palms aren't sweaty. The more your noodles look like a suburban bird's nest, the better. STACK EM HIGH, if you do it right you can balance three or more bird's nests in top of your bowl and by this time your mass should be touching the sneeze guard!  TRIPLE SAUCE. You are a pro, you have trained for this, you spent all that time looking at the YC's menu of sauce combinations online and you have memorized what you want, now triple it. Break out that hidden second large bowl and scoop yo sauce. If you got bowl blocked in the beginning you will need two small bowls and to develop a better slide of hand for next time. Don't bother trying to put sauce in your skyscraper bowl, you will spill, employees will glare at you, just use the extra bowl (s).  RESTACK. If there is a line at the grill, transfer your tray over to the waiting area and attempt to stack any stragglers back on top of your bowl but, just like two a.m. at the club, DO NOT SMASH it!  ASK if the grill person can scrape the grill (it helps to flash some cash at this point to let the grill person know you mean business, tip em if you got em) you spent a lot of time curating your flavor, don't let your predecessors' bowls muck it up!  REMEMBER to mention that it is to go. They will hand you: a small box, a cup, a utensil, a bag. Get them all. Don't get shorted.  SIDES. While you are waiting, fill your box with rice half way and crispy wontons totally smashed half way (still crunchy and delicious, just more food per inch cubed if they are smashed a little, or a lot, w/e). If your gigantic spaceship of food is still being grilled, grab some soup. DRAIN the broth. Broth is for the sick and the rich, you came here for value and to live on left overs for a week. AFTER the soup cup if full of chicken and veggies you can add some broth to keep it warm on the drive home.  COLLECT your food from the grill master. If you have not allotted at least two large boxes and a small box you need more practice.  NO ICE. Ice is for penguins and polar bears, you need soda and have no room for space fillers like frozen water.   MOVE out of the way of others trying to get stuff and things from the small area to do so. Close the tops of your boxes and put them in your plastic bag at a table near the back - far away from the line and the rush. Don't be a menace, while standing there drinking your juice.  Good luck to you on your journey to massive gains, may the odds be ever in your favor.

OEMNnHMEeFTlBWv0Bgy4jw.text: The food is great. Anyone of you who like or don't like this, I will give you hint about this place or other YC's Mongolian Grill. Hint: Put the right ingredients for the food, because if you don't put the right ingredients it will taste badly.

lZ2H0yerO2uJG1NX_8s53w.text: Pretty good food. Kinda pricy for the amount of food you get, but it is enjoyable. I'd definitely recommend this for somebody looking to get some freshly made mongolian style food! you mix your whole meal yourself and the cook will stir fry for you.

cOn9BJsmPu2krJ7WtBn-rQ.text: This is a fine place for the price. Nothing extraordinary about this food except that it's rather healthy. My kids love making their own sauce recipe. And... that's about it.

twEg_eQESt8_Eu-Bnd2VLQ.text: Made for the regulars.  Our first time eating here, selection choices is overwhelming, if you know what you want, it will work out for you.  I piled in meats, veggies, made some mad scientist sauce, it was not that good.  If you know what to add, it will work out for you.

cI9jTICmM0W4ATfXMUuOPw.text: This restaurant is unbelievable in that the help staff are warm, helpful and noticed we're seniors so offered a discount without our asking.  In addition,  the choices, quality and amounts offered were generous and delicious.  I'm vegan, so they were very helpful in showing me options.

B3pyKZOMxFoUwH3hqlEhfw.text: Wow... the staff's attitude is beyond disrespectful. My husband and I came here for lunch, I wasn't hungry so I didn't order anything myself. After his food was prepared we sat outside and started having a conversation. In the middle of it he offered me to try his dish and gave me a fork with a little meat and noodles on it. The same second some employee ran outside and started shouting at us! No, he wasn't quiet and polite, he shouted so people at other tables started looking at us with interest. He said my husband was not allowed to give me to try his food because I didn't pay for it. Huh? ... But the food that was on the table had been paid for?! Doesn't matter. You wanna try it - take it home!  I was speechless. For the first time I felt so insulted by a restaurant employee. We took the rest of the food to go and decided to never come back to this place again.

pWksqrqx62lxC77NmgLxww.text: The waitress behind the cash register deserves a raise for all of her amazing help and guidance during our visit, she was fantastic. The food was great and so was being able to dine outside and enjoy the weather!

oKSd4ZDDXMuvaU1jBNqS7g.text: Since I eat at Mongolian BBQ as often as possible where I live in California, I was excited to find a place in a very new area of Arizona. This area is a place that didn't even exist when I was growing up here.   So I have to say since I have been to so many, this is not a new concept for me, and I can compare what I know to be great Mongolian to this.   To educate those that have never been to one, you usually can get as many bowls as you want to use to create the master dish you want to be cooked together. Here, they yelled at us for using more than one bowl and told us to push it down with a piece of paper .... what?!? And meanwhile, those around me where doing it making a huge mess, how could they not? This rule is absurd. Take two bowls and fill them up as you like, then they are cooked together and the cook turns it back to you in one HUGE bowl that is the size of the two small ones that you filled up with even more room.   I am just used to little authentic Mongolian places where there are no rules as to how you create your master dish. And this thing with either all you can eat or one trip for a dollar less is just ridiculous. Just make it one price, all you can eat period. Allowing customers to choose between two choice that have a dollar difference was creating such a negative atmosphere in there with the server going around and telling everyone what they are doing wrong and that they have to get the all you can eat if they use more than one bowl, and if they do all you can eat, they still can only use one bowl. Its just not a good set up for happy customers.   The fun party about Mongolian is being your own master chief, let your customers do that without ridiculous restrictions on bowl usage and smashing down food to make rood for more to pile it up like a tower that is falling down all over the counter.

2ZWfz6nPCiv-rFdtVOfP7g.text: This place is great! Create your own masterpiece. Stack your bowl high with lots of meat and veggies, then read the chalkboard for your favorite sauce combo. Plenty to eat and very delicious  The workers are very helpful and friendly. I highly recommend this place.

cMYr-Kw4bgU6UrybcjwQNw.text: Pretty good. I only wish there was a way to remember which sauce I like. I always spend forever debating which to try and haven't managed to get it quite as good as the first time I came in. This place is a lot of fun. I recommend overstuffing your bowl and getting a box

3Y2dzksJ6gam0N8cDpYnlQ.text: Today was my first visit to YC'S Mongolian Grill and I had a great experience. I walked in and was greeted by Maria and when asked if I had ever been here before I explained that I hadn't.  Maria then walked me through the process and made sure that I had everthing that I needed.  Unfortunately I found a hair in my food but Maria came by and appoligized for the hair and asked me I wanted to start over.  End of story, right. Wrong, Maria brought me a card for a free meal and when I explained that I didn't need that and wasn't looking for that she told me that was exactly why she gave it to me. I will be visiting here again, and the food was great!!!!!

I22C0_ZOirDCF_rlhB9GtA.text: This place is delicious. It's a build-your-own type of place. You get a bowl and add your choice of meat, vegetables, noodles, and sauce. You can stack it as high as you want to. For two large bowls it was $24. It came with two drinks, two servings of wontons, and two soups. Can't wait to go back! I did take off one star because they carry Pepsi products instead of Coke.

q_WtKQophoRPlpYFlvJdGQ.text: Been to multiple Mongolian bbqs around California and Nevada and this is by far the best. The ability to add as much meat (chicken, beef, Turkey, pork and fish) as you want not to mention the unlimited veggies puts this place above others.  They also give you the ability to make your own sauce recipes. You can choose curry, sweet and sour, teriyaki, soy sauce combos, amongst others. This plus the unlimited drinks makes this place stand above the rest.  I highly recommend this place.

M2uToh4aRuo8DqCDKOfJBg.text: The best place to eat a healthy bowl. Only thing I hate are the locations there are just not enough locations. I would spend so much $ here to eat with my family if they had a Glendale/Peoria location even metro Phoenix at the least. I only have a very lil opportunity to stop by when work takes me near by.  1 place to eat.

WERESQCj1aT7WP4MIEOTpw.text: Love this place. Get the big bowl and a Togo box. It's just as good the second time!  Oh, and stop staring at my bowl...I know it's good.

W4ttd2ui_nFSM9OLPFLgAg.text: This place is so good I would drive 50 miles to get there every week.  Fortunately, it is only about 10 miles for me.  Try it and you will be hooked!

5eNEDmE9sWbtk9UhqFJ-LA.text: Clean, priced right, fresh and healthy, lots of choices for your bowl, polite staff, and the right to pile your bowl high!  What's not to like???

oJ_wPwA3vwCnqYbhAGBXbw.text: In general I like Mongolian Grill concept restaurants and YC's is no different. First visit was kind of underwhelming but this location has a good vibe, helpful notes and sauce combinations written on a chalkboard and a speedy service which  is hard to beat. However, it fails to excel in any distinguishable way which leaves it firmly in the good but not great category. Everything others have posted in their five star reviews is True, your mileage will depend on how much you value portion size, unlimited drinks, etc. Definitely a solid lunch spot.

jhbYYcPcPkqIjRFhfjzgPA.text: First time here and first time at a mongolian grill period.....nice experience.....staff is so helpful and attentive from the moment that you walk through their doors up until you leave....they did great at making our first experience pretty dang good....you pac what u want how high u want it and if u don't have enough of meat they will let u know to fill it up to the rim..... if u don't know what kind of sauce u want u got a staff member  down there to make life a lil bit easier lol....no but seriously this place is great....will be coming back indeed!!!!! it's located back by Home depot I almost missed it....clean, Great customer Service and I'm a very happy customer!!!!! See u all later!!!!!

gNhH7lfcRtnccaCNmwav6Q.text: The aroma drew me after leaving  the movies.  You get a bowl.  Choose a frozen meat.  Top it with seasoning salt of ur Choosing, veggies add that with a bowl of marinade. Rice or some sort of noodle.  Then u wait,  observe, collect your drink.  Sit and eat.   Then yogurt.  All under 12 bucks.  And so much to take home.  Very pleased with this find!

B32qA6w3NuXXjlwYnmvJLA.text: I always leave YC's feeling full and wonderful. I love how they encourage you to stuff your bowl full of food by supplying tissues to pack it down. The staff is so friendly and always offer to make your sauces. I suggest getting the large bowl them getting a to-go container. They also have soup you can fill up on so the to-go container is totally worth it. Now I don't need to eat for the rest of the day.

htZP0W4NhfPvck03cij6TA.text: One word for YC's - Delicious!  That's partly because you pick your own ingredients and sauces, and you can really heap the food on in the small bowl.   Highly recommended.

bXUx4ZotW4YPQWg-pNX5qg.text: Poor selection of meats. Noodles are terrible. Disappointing for Mongolian. I would not return.

u3CY_QFZ2C8ceCMKiAuXtA.text: I have eaten here for years and years as the movie theatres and surrounding restaurants (and even an entire row of buildings!) has come and gone. YC's has remained and it's still as tasty as ever. Grab a bowl (don't bother getting the big one if you can save a buck, there's no way you'll be able to eat the full portion of even the smaller bowl, lol), grab a wax paper to smush all the good ingredients down into the bowl, and go to town. I like that they added extra bowls up by the sauces a while ago, since previously you were guaranteed to slosh sauce all over your tray :P  The ingredients are always fresh and tasty, they have a nice selection of options, and the sides at the end are nice (I like the tasty, if not a bit salty beef soup - add a glob of brown rice into it and mm it is delish!). Also, after trying Genghis grill - YC's system of keeping the meet choices cold/semi frozen is the way to go - the meat looked NASTY at Genghis in comparison.   It's not a fancy place, it's not the cheapest place for quick food... but man if you want to eat some dang tasty stir-fry until you need to unbutton your pants and call a flatbed truck to take you home - YC's is the place!

GEpcgYM4_G-3MSfMf6dzOA.text: One of the best experiences I've had in a long time.  It is clean, food lines are laid out very well with constant re-stocking of fresh food.  You have the option of in or out door dinning.

GyUutu0i5yX-QvVxhopN7w.text: Every time we come here it's always clean the staff is very efficient the food is amazing and just has a feeling that makes you want to hang out and enjoy a family lunch. Thanks for the wonderful food

F8SqoCPIFNv0doOeEWjmcw.text: So I have visited this place several times in between my first review and this review and they have managed to keep their 5 star rating. Tonight was the epitome of it all! I could not believe how delicious my meal was. I did finally try a new sauce: Kung Pao, so I don't know if that was it or not but everything was cooked to perfection. It was the busiest I have ever seen the restaurant too.   The staff, which was clearly under a lot of pressure, did not compromise their customer service at all. There was a woman helping out the chefs who was extremely courteous and would help you out with whatever you want. She kept the line moving and was very efficient. The chefs were also really nice! My mom has a food allergy. When you mention you have a food allergy they clean the entire cook top and get new utensils. Most places have an attitude because it's extra work for them. Not this place, they were very nice and were able to accommodate my mom's request. Even when she asked for the food to be cooked well done with not a lot of water, the chef said "sure" and made her food to perfection.   Love this place!

bOW56GaVv4sXLwLl458mbA.text: Great fresh food. good value. Manager asked if everything was good several times which was a pleasant surprise nowadays. Will be back

Nx8oy9sQFh8P-P67Mwoopw.text: A good place for Chinese Mongolian. You get as much as you can fit in the bowl. So push down hard and squash the meat down into the bowl. Pretty much build your bowl the way you want. You get your money's worth. The price includes meal, drink and ice cream.

9_jchUurxQTwbbTW1niHsw.text: The manager here is AWESOME, and the rest of the staff is really good. We love this place. The food is always on point, our kids enjoy it and there's always enough for another meal for a next days lunch for a great price. Highly recommend this place

apwsDACPUBdrMpyEVQpb7g.text: Food is always great and the line is very fresh. We visited last week and the staff was absolutely amazing. They offered to carry one of my trays as my hands were full (I have 3 kids). Walking through the line they offered to help with sauces and were constantly cleaning and refilling. This place is an amazing deal for what you pay and totally worth every penny.

lxpDXx-SRf4XcUXn6dMsmQ.text: Always a safe bet!  We eat at YC's weekly. It is a consistently great meal made just the way you want it.  Staff is friendly, and you will never leave hungry!  Their prices have recently increased, and frozen yogurt is now an additional charge (at dinner too).

WVk8oj-u6G-9a1o0Qzg01A.text: The food is delightful.  Make sure if its your first time you ask for help. Use an extra bowl instead of the "pushing paper"   Food is always fresh and usually pretty high quality. I love the wheat noodles and creating my own sauces. The tofu is always delightful.   4 stars because the prices keep going up and up and up... And the bowls get smaller and smaller.

3io0JA65hGgugZIT87elfw.text: Food was great, and as always the portions are always big! This place is always "poppin" on Saturday nights. (The only nights I've ever gone) food is definitely good as far as how you prepare it. Easy concept, think of being in chipotle. It can get a little pricey but it's definitely worth giving a try maybe once.

RAigNtmqRtkjmcluvV5aSA.text: Love this place so much. One of my trips to YC'S was almost a disaster for me because I decided to experiment with my sauces and accidentally made my sauce too hot for me to eat. When the server walked by she asked how the food was and I hesitantly said "it's really spicy" and she immediately offered me another metal bowl to make start a new dish. I was eternally grateful because my food would have gone to waste and I hate wasting Ycs or anything really. Definitely gonna continue to love these guys :)

zqzkuLwAFXtlzblb2B4g5Q.text: YC's is awesome. Plain and simple. Awesome.   When you eat at YC's, you are not simply a patron. You become an architect-chef-artist hybrid; the ingredient bar becomes your palette, your hands become your paintbrush, and your bowl becomes your canvas. After paying your $10.25, you are given permission to create a masterpiece.  Your first stop on this culinary Safari is at the meats. Slightly frozen, these curls of chicken, beef, pork, and cod look kinda freaky to be honest. But give it time. By midnight these freaky little meat swirls will become your Cinderella. You will be longing for more. This is also the beginning of your architect job. You must begin balancing your bowl in such a way as to create a stable mountain of Mongolian delicacies maximizing the $10.25 entrance fee. You do so by utilizing the parchment paper provided and squishing all of your ingredients to their basic form in your bowl. Watch someone else if it's your first time. It's an art.   Next step the vegetables. Still utilizing the parchment paper to hulk smash every ingredient down to its most compact form, continue to pack that baby with everything you can! The veggies are also fresh and delicious.   Finally: stacking noodles. This is the most vital step in your architect role. Pile these babies on!!! The wheat noodles are like strings of happiness. They will make you smile.   The last role that you must play is that of chef. It's more like mad scientist. At this point in front of you there are seemingly hundreds of containers of magic potions (or sauces) and you are given the task of creating the elixir of life. The sauces are delicious no matter what you do. Don't fret too much.   Lastly you hand your heaping mountain of Mongolian BBQ to the gentlemen that will shortly become your best friend. He will then take your masterpiece and turn it into a steaming heap of bliss. At this point, you enjoy.   YCs is delicious. Go there for lunch. Or dinner. Or your birthday. Or your graduation. Or one year anniversary. Or 20 year anniversary. Or wedding. Or anytime.

6l2FalZw6bfumDj7W9z8DQ.text: Wow wow wow! A friend recommended I try this place and Wow! I love it! I love how it's buffet style. Plus it comes with soup and amazing wonton chips! Yummy! The staff helped me pick sauces to use and all told me to pack my bowl to the max! The price is about 13.00 but it was worth every penny! I had left overs! It became two meals for the price of one! I will make many trips here. Great concept and great food.

RbvY7jQ55zADOLyzCIcnxg.text: I just don't understand why you would pour an entire pitcher of water on the food your grilling. All the sauce and spices you add to your meal just get washed right off. Bye bye flavor.... Also, the cooks need to find some personality. I get you're probably working for minimum wage but your tip jar would fill up faster with a simple "Hello, how are you?"

AQZjn2lnVRtKvsREnfnTLQ.text: OK I've eaten here for years and never ever had a problem. The food is great and moderately priced for the portions.  Being a family of four (wife, kids and i) we have found that two servings to go is plenty of food to feed us all. My kids are both under 10 and barely eat lol.  During our trip through the buffet line creating our masterpiece bowls, my wife was informed that we had to leave if we were getting our food to go. I simply asked why? She informed me that there's no sharing.  I asked well Is it endless trips to buffet? -She says no. I say so why does it matter, we like to get it to go because we can't eat it all and we will take what's left home. She then told me that by doing that we are RIPPING THE OFF! I Know that this is just an employee speaking there mind without a filter and I assume management wouldn't approve but this definitely upset my wife and made us leary of returning.    Brings back a saying I've heard: "Don't hate the player, hate the game"  YCS YOU SHOULD TELL YOUR EMPLOYEES TO ENCOURAGE FAMILY'S TO ENJOY THEMSELVES NOT INSULT THEM OVER A FEW DOLLARS. LOYALTY?

BKgycQIDkWi-PYr07bKzRw.text: I love coming to YC's because I know the food will always be delish. I love making my own plate of food and I love seeing it cooked before my eyes! The staff is always super friendly and helpful every time I come back.

agU723wO9tnpZhsyRKvC4A.text: Much better food and experience compared to Tempe. I mean I shouldn't be surprised that Scottsdale is better than Tempe. But this place is really good.

IRnOxHvgjLWHguWwD2u2ng.text: Service last night was excellent! We purchased the all you can eat bowl which included drinks and soft serve dessert. A good deal. Really loved that they offer gluten free options and they have unsweetened iced tea so I have options to keep myself on track health-wise. The black pepper sauce was my favorite sauce. Not too sweet but would not have been as good if not for their new cilantro garlic chili sauce. They have this in a bottle at the pick up area. I will be back again and will bring the whole family.

jU-a5KoNeoegFh-h4shHng.text: I love the food here, but my main reason for the positive feedback is a staff member I had the pleasure of meeting tonight. Occasionally I encounter an individual in a hospitality or customer service environment that truly stands out - specifically, one who is sincere, knowledgeable, and pleasant. Elizabeth at this location is a perfect example of these attributes. She was attentive without being overbearing, and seemed like the kind of employee who takes pride in everything she does. Her genuinely kind demeanor really made my night, and I imagine she has had that impact on many other people who've dined here, too. Thanks for demonstrating what great customer service looks like, Elizabeth!

xtXhGVBuOo2_nFZdnpY-zw.text: My daughter & I came to this location after a bad experience at Mongolian Grill in Tempe. We were instantly greeted by BEN I believe the manager. Wow! All I can say . He was outgoing personality & was so nice! He made sure we always had beverages filled and took our dishes quickly. We will definitely make this our new location. Thank you to Ben who knows what True customer service is! Ps he needs a well deserved raise!

cHFtHKIN-wu4oyK3UCNcow.text: I've been coming to YC's since i discovered this place while i was attending Scottsdale Community College.  Many many lunches were had here in between classes with friends!   It's always clean and the ingredients are always fresh.  Staff is super helpful and you can't beat a place that lets you make your own food!  so if you end up not liking it you have no one to blame but yourself in the end!    A pro tip would be to spend the little extra on the unlimited bowl and make small portions of items to try different things you normally wouldn't instead of making one huge bowl.  Love this place and hope it is around for many more years!

BOfuQwEhxX4jnCa4_e-lmw.text: Great place.  Very friendly.  Got our volleyball team in and even had someone refilling drinks.  Highly recommended.

5QP9b3vbKVcjEr6MzMauig.text: Wow! Great service and friendly staff make the meal even better!! Thanks for showing us Arizona hospitality!

pH9vkTupGepI0-GtJUOUXg.text: One of the best lunch date spots in the valley! fun and interactive; spicy hunan for the win baby!

NDh0rpiWRH_MFoxRX0AxUw.text: Amazing food that is so fun to put together yourself. The manager along with other staff members are very helpful and nice. I will definitely be returning in the future! I love the atmosphere and the fact that I have some leftovers.

HqhL3wkNAjvIURJytkYt7w.text: My husband and I came in for lunch today and were greeted by Ben, who turned out the be the manager. We were very impressed with the great customer service he provided. These days it's very rare to find great customer service. Kim came around to assist with making the sauce, which was perfect!  She was very pleasant and helpful as were the chefs. The restaurant was clean, well stocked and food was fantastic. While the location is a little bit out of our way, we will be back. Thank you Ben for making our experience so awesome!!!

W8ZaBJEutnNMHyPlUkzeKQ.text: Been coming here for years and they never disappoint! Two days with a full, happy belly for the price of one! Pack it high ppl, only $.50 for a to go box!

jOXozs88_kpwPxH8aYrZlg.text: This is the best restaurant ever!! My favorite place to bring friends and family. I even had my birthday dinner here. 13/10 would recommend! I found a new love for mongolian barbecue at this spot.

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Yst1CWOzo8ZfCjBlDPO0qA.text: This restaurant reminds my husband and I of a Mongolian barbecue restaurant we use to frequent when we lived in Vancouver, Washington back in 2002.  This restaurant serves up a delightful array of proteins, vegetables, noodles, sauces, dry rubs, rice and fried won ton with sauces. You go down the line and build a bowl--large or small that you are handed at the register where you pay for the bowls. The meal includes a drink. There is huge grill where it's all cooked together. At the end by the grill there is brown and white rice, wontons and sweet and sour sauce for the won tons. Our waitress gave us each a cup to put frozen yogurt in as a treat from her. She was very friendly, welcoming and  nice. (The frozen yogurt is an extra $1.00 if you want to add it on to your meal). Our meal was delicious, hot and fresh. We enjoyed eating here. We will definitely be back.
