Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

f1xG4AojvXtznGBJqCBrGQ.text: We are a family with multiple allergies.  As such this is a wonderful place for us. They clean everything for an allergy cook.  Our kids loved the food.  We had plenty of leftovers for multiple meals.  The service was incredible. They custom mixed a sauce for my gluten free son. No worrying about my mixing it and getting the proportions wrong. Being from out of town the manager answered questions about the area for us.  Definitely would recommend this location.

2zAnhDlX5fvtJwGp6-oBhA.text: I've been coming here for years now and i cannot believe the service is still as good as it was when i first started coming here. always greeted with a smile and feel welcomed to the fullest extent. COME TO YCS IN SCOTTSDALE AND GET THE BEST STIR FRY IN AZ...your way!

NvHIikOXIdrOI4etzDMGDA.text: My family and I have been coming to this restaurant since 2009 when we moved here. We always come home with leftovers because the portions end up being huge! The options have grown over the past ten years and I love it! There are so many combinations you can do, from the seasoning and sauce combinations to what you actually put in your bowl. Getting the perfect bowl does take practice, but the workers are always so willing to help. It's also nice to see a friendly face every time we come here (shoutout to the guy with the spiky hair!!). This place feels like a second home since we come here so often.

x0fOHssPgg7-3FpCAnj66w.text: I've been to other Mongolian grills but this was by far the best tasting.  Made a huge bowl and ton of left overs.  I wish there was one closer to me, but definitely worth the drive

wnEehp6kaY3fT78YkKr6Rg.text: Ben is amazing! The food was great and the restaurant is so clean. Thanks for the great experience! :-)

pNgQ_kZ8uDevVy2LdFf9ZA.text: Brought the family here for lunch before the aquarium. Food was delicious but more importantly the customer service was 5 star incredible. Manager was so helpful in getting a big table setup/wiped down, letting us grab drinks and get situated, and then walking us all through the station line giving us tips and tricks and then offering to make our sauces for us! The manager also came by and refilled our drinks and cleared our table. Seriously great service by him made the experience so good we will be back!

hJwkvBtKi-0sFFl_XCaWMA.text: YC's Mongolian Grill has gotten me through so much more than you could imagine. Through every drastic change in my life, they've been there for me. It's insane that I used to physically smash all kinds of meat in my bowl like some kind of game. Over a year ago, I switched to a vegan diet and found my options for eating out to be so limited. You can imagine my excitement when I realized I only had to slightly modify my bowls to adjust to my lifestyle. Recently revisited the Scottsdale location I used to frequent in high school and I gotta say they've really stepped it up. I owe it all to Ben. The whole experience was so welcoming and friendly. It felt like a whole new place. Ben made sure everything was perfect and even offered to box my food up for me.

X8S3Td7AUlxdJJd6RkJCNA.text: The only thing better than being treated like a newbie at YC's is being treated like family. My sisters and I have been going to YC's for years and it's so nice to always be treated kindly, courteously and get great food to top it off! Elisabeth is our favorite hostess because as busy as she gets, she always stops to say hello and make sure we have everything we need. The food is great and the service is even better! :)

DyPPg5S0fFnubBJRO8QgfQ.text: Love this place. Gone here for years, as a casual lunch w/my dad.  Easy place to hangout w/free refills on soda/tea & soup/rice.  It's worth it to pay a few bucks for a to-go box.  Leftovers=another whole meal!

ErTjEt6jTdswjgUH_X2DpQ.text: This place is great! You fill your bowl with raw meat, vegetables, noodles and sauce - they cook it for you, and you can fill up on sides like soup, rice, crispy wonton chips and more! Location isn't great, and the dining room is a tight squeeze, but the staff is great and more than willing to help out with whatever you need! Be sure to go at dinner for the "prime" offerings!

UALIArgieT-ODcoAkhfaAA.text: The best Mongolian BBQ I have had. They have lots of choices to stuff in your bowl! Make sure you pack your bowl full because it shrinks when they cook it. They even provide papers to use to pack your bowl down and so your hands don't get messy. The sauce station is where the magic happens. They have plenty of recipes to follow or you can make up your own. They have great prices, lots of seating, and friendly customer service.

ta_DbgjOivTqXvdnW_Kr2Q.text: Squish squish so you can Eat a Dish. How Crazy is that? They even provide wax paper just for squishing down your food to CRUSH as much as you can into the tiny dish.  I was a first timer and didn't know the squish thing or even had an idea what the wax paper was for until I saw OTHER PEOPLE displaying humiliating , embarrassing ,  disgraceful behavior crushing down food and then piling maybe as high as 10 inches above the bowl. Some people actually had to jump in the air to squish. ( I am sorry now I didn't video and send this up to You Tube.)  The meats and vegetables seemed fresh and I didn't notice any vegetables being canned (like at the Gag Us Chain) But I really didn't like the watered down sauces. Unlike the other stir fry places here you need to add maybe 7 ladle's of sauces to get the correct flavor and then you get a BOILED vegetable dish. YUCK!  I know MOST people enjoy coming here and doing the squish thing eating a boiled dish of food for approx. $10 but I can go to my favorite Chinese and get a rice bowl that taste better and is bigger and not crushed food for only $3.50 or spring for the whole lunch plate for only $4.95 so you won't be seeing me here again.  As for Stir Fry Places I like the independent Stir Fry place on Bell Rd is better than this place or the Gag Us Chain because I don't have to squish down food , I (don't) but I can go back and get as many Stir Fry's as I like at that place and the sauces aren't watered down so the food comes out better.   To each his own . Different Stir Fry's for different folks Eat what YOU like!

MkQM7JajkL_pvD24o-uN5w.text: Make sure you mush as much as you can in your bowl, hee hee. :)  A fun and good place for some Asian!

cPiNJhv174r_dG1sTfs-Tg.text: Been coming here for 15 years....  Pro's - variety on bowl options many - quality of produce good - staff friendly and helpful  Con's - maybe a tad over priced by $1 or so.  Never liked the new smaller metal bowls.   Will continue visiting from time to time...

N5Of1BLIORB433qGh_i6pQ.text: Great price for what you can get! Food is always delicious and they get you in and out quick. Sometimes the brown rice isn't cooked all the way, but other than that I love the place!

UTy-wPzZb7BDTo4LR5WXNQ.text: This YC's, compared to the other ones in Tempe, has a better selection of diet soda drinks at the soda fountain (Sprite Zero Diet Coke, and Caffeine Free Diet Coke), and service is very friendly and speedy.  I believe the meat selections are the same (white and dark meat chicken, pork, beef, fish in the evening), but I like the selection of veggies here, which includes water chestnut and baby corn.  The addition of various blended spices to your bowl, in addition to the plethora of sauces to choose from, adds to the experience.  Yum!

XbOSsdhDLbitZecY4auEJw.text: This is a great YC's, their service and management were great! We came in with a ton of kids after a movie and we were taken care of so well.  I love the selection and quality and their sauces are the best, way better than any other MG in the valley.  The chef's soup was out of this world, through a few wontons on it, dang! Thats whatsup!

aQqxlU9iT2TnBxsrglrQWw.text: Tried this for dinner again last night...  This is such a good, healthy meal and at such a reasonable price. The ingredients are so fresh and the experience of getting it right off the grill is really cool. Dinner was exactly $10 each and included the drink, tax, etc...   The atmosphere here is nice for $10 meals. Lunch and dinner rush can get a little hectic.

1-tRPrAobXc5fiD-eCELaQ.text: YC's is a great interactive meal. Start at the register and pay, then walk your way through the line picking your frozen meats, veggies, and topping with noodles and broths to make your custom stir fry meal. You'll see the pros with parchment paper in hand, smashing down the goods to make room for more. My fave meat is the beef, I love tons of celery, cabbage, carrots. I personally skip on the noodles to go for the steamed white rice. Also love the egg drop soup and breaking up some wonton strips into that. You pay for a takeout box, but it is always worth it for me to take home another full meal. Expect YC's burps for the next few hours. Warn your loved ones.

6qz_ZVkb8zpQKYpFRf4XjQ.text: This place has the most amazing food, which is the only reason we will continue to come back. We were approached by an employee and reprimanded (albeit nicely) for sharing. They made us put half our food into another bowl so it wouldnt look like we're sharing. Forcing people to spend more and eat more than they want is a terrible thing - talk about contributing to obesity. This is not a buffet - what fits in your bowl goes, so this makes no sense to me.

Ug06nePkUcEa-2PUB-Ij0Q.text: When you come here be ready to eat!   For those of you who do not know how this place works....you get a bowl and basically go to a buffet style set up where you pack raw meats and uncooked veggies into your bowl. You can put as much as you want, I wouldn't exactly say fit in your bowl, because the food is always overflowing. Once you have loaded up your bowl you pick the sauce(s) you want to use. There are recipes for different kinds of sauces available for you. After that, your food is cooked infront of you in about 3-5 minutes.   After that you take it to your table and enjoy...I would suggest filling your bowl up with a lot of noodles, even if your bowl is completely filled.

KODpRVDJn0FQqUvjVgex6Q.text: I've been coming here since they opened, and visiting the Pavilions since it opened in the early 90's.  I'm also a reputable business owner, and a valley resident since '79.  I know good management and a good crew when I see one.  Geoff and his long time crew are amazing.  My wife and I eat here like clockwork every single week.  It is miraculous that they stay so on top of everything with the business/volume that they do.  The employees here are clearly a reflection of the 5 star management, and this is a well run operation.  I do have one complaint- I've gone to other "wok" places and Mongolian style places, expecting the same thing- boy am I spoiled from YCs... they don't even come close- we "woked" away without even eating at YC's competition.

zYECFDyt-TyE34cEbBOwtg.text: We really like it here. The manager is always helpful and the food is made by you so how can it be screwed up! Taught the frenchie to eat off of chopsticks. He made a mess but enjoyed it just the same. Love the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

X_0b48Fd08HD2QqKTCuF8A.text: This place is YUM!  I like that you can customize your bowl and add the things you like best.  The service was very helpful as well.  Lots of great choices and the food was delicious.

UhlzSK-MEk8kiyDB8aNvrg.text: Love this place! A lot of bang for the buck! Prices are affordable, food is always fresh and staff is always very helpful & friendly. Besides filling up on meat or fish and veggies, there is soup and rice and drinks are included.. Will eat here again & again.  You get as much as you can put in a bowl and if you want to take home the remainder it costs only 50 cent. You can make it according to you own liking.

2dGWH9CdTz9fLqBq5Tvo5g.text: I am a big fan of YC's! I love the wide variety of options for your bowl and the wonderful sauce options. I particularly like the soups, rice and chips with sweet and sour sauce!! I could eat bowl after bowl of those chips with sauce!!! I am literally getting hungry as I write this review...  I didn't give YC's 5 stars for 2 reasons. 1 is that their prices keep going up. I swear everytime I go the price for a bowl has gone up. I think the last time I was there for dinner a bowl was $11.50. The other reason is that you have to pay for a to-go box!! I think that is a total rip off!!!  Other than that, YC's is great and delicious. I would recommend for a filling lunch or dinner.

PA7t6qyt01X0mQm2zelAtQ.text: I"m so glad we rediscovered this place.  My friend and I had been all grubby painting and were driving around doing an errand on a Sunday early evening when all of a sudden i start feeling bitchy.  Which means my hunger headache was about to hit.  We were in South Scottsdale at the time so we were searching for a place to go as is (pretty grubby) and so we hightailed it to YC's.  I hadn't been here since college which was a lifetime ago.  So glad we came here.  It was really good.  You pick different various meats, veggies, noodles, sauces and they grill it all for you. I totally packed in the bowl.  The price also includes a beverage, side of rice (they have both brown and white), and desert afterwards.  What a deal!    Just fyi....if you can't finish what you got and you have to ask for a to go container they charge like 50 cents for the container.

dj4kdxQVRhGFsYBXmwclDg.text: We headed over to YC's on a Saturday night. A little more casual than we were looking for on a Saturday night, but that was our choice.   We had no idea what to do and one of their helpful employees explained everything. While I could have liked what I put together more I now have a better idea what to do for my next visit.  The best part was going to the car show just outside the door after dinner on a Saturday night.  This is the type of place Arizona needs more of.

B1mHHZPDXSbbS-lxfhrqPQ.text: My wife, my two young's kids and I went to YC's for the first time over the weekend.  It was honestly a great experience! First of all, Ben was great! He went above and beyond and management needs to make sure and take care of that guy as he was incredibly helpful and friendly.  Also as we walked out it seemed like he was just best friends with everyone he was assisting.  The food was delicious and the portions were more than enough. The kids were given a frozen yogurt to top it off.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant and location!

KTiQuuhh6LIkvOIib7lGQA.text: This is the best YC's I have visited so far. The customer service is excellent. Their food quality is beyond your expectations. Their manager/supervisor walked up to our counter and asked said, "What are you drinking, lemonade?" I said, "Yes." Next thing you know, he brings over a new filled drink. That was just the nicest thing. If I were allowed to give a tip, I definitely would have. No regrets coming to YCs. (Get an extra sauce bowl, and you'll be happy!)

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dCzQWfTkS8f1t40zPTYw8g.text: Really enjoy this place, fun and delicious. Our kids love it too! The service is great, everyone is very helpful!

UikUw0rDOwkgBUM6JcIMlg.text: Great food! Wide variety of fixings to please everyone in the family. The extra's (rice, soup, wontons) put the meal over the top. Four kinds of fresh brewed tea plus a soda station with flavor shots! My three sons were very pleased and eager to return.

cTtXqZfabS0t9dAr2GBkPw.text: I've been coming here for 15+ years and quality has always been there. Today we had a great experience with the friendly staff too!

Ba_OgWSlGS6oYWOYcVpyCA.text: Love this place. Always fun to pile up the food and the service is always great. Ben the manager us always super helpful and friendly.

Yw4jxgkg5xMeUhAeXBbvIg.text: This has been my favorite spot for the last 20 years. Came in today, the remodel looks fantastic and the food is as good as ever.

lppGBpV6b78ngdp-FsHQVQ.text: Been going here for over 20 years and still the best Mongolian place I've ever had! Super fun environment for family time or even to go on dates! You get to choose exactly what meal you're going to have, and it's always delicious!!! One of the best restaurants, and super convenient to know and control what's going into your food!

dzJtoYUYW9a_AwCdyMyiTQ.text: Oh solid as always great food and quality tea. Cant wait to return. Great people great time

4qXPyFgRAMEaSc66FJEGug.text: Great service begins from the top down. I recently ate there with my wife and two kids.  Were were joined by our friends and their two kids.  We had a great time.  We received a great greeting, and everybody we spoke with was friendly.  You can tell that they all feed of of then Manager, Ben's positive energy.  The food was great, as always, and the restaurant, and restroom were clean.  Everything was well stocked. I take special notice of things like this, having owned and operated restaurants myself.  RECOMMENDATIONS: I know they are operating with a limited amount of counter space for items like cups, drink station, forks, etc.  With that being said, great idea putting a second fountain drink station in the dining room.  That really helps to lessen the crowding by the one closest to the cooking station.  I would suggest that they do place a caddy with more forks, knives and napkins over by the dining room fountain machine.  This will also help to prevent some of the congestion by caddy that is by he cooks.  Face it, how many times do we forget to get utensils, or they fall on the floor?  I know it happens to all of us.  Anyway, if you're in the area and have never tried YC's, I highly recommend it, and if you are familiar with it, enjoy!!!  See you soon YC's.

iCIEXH1FliUxVgpTWo0oxA.text: So I've been going to the car show for years I've never been to this place one reason is most the Mongolian grills aren't very good they're expensive and usually make my stomach hurt afterwards and make me real gassy but this one then it good priced they even put paper down so you could smash all your food in the bowl to get more in it who does that they do or a dollar more you can have all you can eat but I put beef all kinds of vegetables some noodles and all their sauces are delicious at least the ones I picked the guy that cooks it does it perfectly Meats cooked all the way through vegetables are just hard enough so they're tender and they keep all their flavor and texture awesome and no gassy afterwards which is even better they have his beef soup when she was really good little spicy Bold Flavor and put the topping on the cake that's all you can eat ice cream I had three didn't really want to drive home afterwards by made it there I think it's my new spot every time I go to the car show

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JRo_aWi4IkD430UdVkUUIQ.text: I came for the first time and it was such a great experience! Ben walked me through the process and helped me make the tastiest sauce! I will definitely be coming back!

AZ4WAYDfnduUWLEM0XXqGQ.text: Awesome customer service! It's a great place to fill up because you can choose as much or as little food as you want for a great price. Delicious!

iqtskGFlcL9C7iMKNFfI5A.text: Found this place by accident and so happy we did! From the moment we entered, Kim made our experience a great one. The food was yummy too. Only wish this place was closer to where we live in Washington state!

1giroEk6WO3lF-VUtE-2aA.text: Yc's always bomb! Cool manager came up to our table to take drinks so all I had to do was eat! 10/10 would recommend!

qWd6WjnsTWoRkfmp_xP6cg.text: Awesome place to eat with friends and family!  I had the pleasure to get some help from Kim for more information about the sauce to add to my bowl ! Ramon he is doing a great job doing what he does on grill he makes my food taste like heaven. Last but not least I had ran into Sergio nice guy. Sergio had asked  me if I needed any help or questions about the food he was refilling he made my experience very welcoming. Atmosphere was very comfortable will recommend for anyone!!

sC7fo2G3hCe0lOrEVuRsGQ.text: Super awesome place!! One of my favorite places to come. The environment and employees are always so nice :)

xd_OH9448rGuJBnUvROYsw.text: Is this place a chain? Yes. And a good one with decent prices. Being a fitness finato, this is right across the street from Mountainside so any easy go to for lunch or dinner after a workout.   The place is very clean and offers a variety of meats, veggies, and grain/ noodles to cook on the grill. Its ready in minutes! To boot, there's complimentary soups in the event you're prone to becoming hangry. What is very special about this place to me, is they also cater to those who avoid carbs by making a "noodle" from kholrabi. I'm not particularly fond of spaghetti squash and these people nailed it with a veggie substitute.  Healthy, tasty... you choose your own spices and sauces. I'm a happy camper.

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Towards the back are 2 giant grills. You take your bowl to them and they saute it right there in front of you.
Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. That is the buffet - you choose various meats and veggies to be sauted on the grill.
Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Better pic of the udon noodles.

9rThAyK1am83yQ9d2epPNA.text: Well if you are good at packing food into a bowl, then you'll love this place. You can order a large or a small bowl... which I think you still can get as much as a large bowl if you pack enough into a small bowl. But anyway, you go through a buffet style line, stuffing meat, veggies and noodles into a bowl before they stir fry it for you. At this location, you start with the meats. There are beef, white chicken, dark chicken and Alaskan Cod. Compare to other places, the meat selection is quite limited. Even though vegetables which include tofu, baby corn, carrots, broccoli, bean sprouts, etc., are also a limited selection. There are a variety of sauces that you can mix or you can follow the recipe on the menu.  I guess the good thing is for $11, you can get a huge bowl of food. And there's free soup, which is ok... but you do also get a free drink (tea, soda) and you can buy yogurt for one dollar! So for the amount of money you pay, you get a lot of food. So I would say it's a good place to go for food. Just do it when it's not busy so you have more time to pack your bowl with ingredients. Be sure to make a mountain, get a lot of meat, a small portion of vegetables and keep piling whatever else on until it literally starts falling out of the bowl. LOL. And then you'll get your money's worth.

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Added pineapples
Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beef chicken and cod
Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Could have made it taller.

VaSOEng4aU8_uuoHMb7WHg.text: It was absolutely disgusting! The sauces are the worst part. Never going back. It definitely is an acquired taste. The only neat thing is that you can all you can eat for $1 more

o78tyoqc4P7qyol4NYiOQg.text: I love the premise of Mongolian grills, but this one was just ok. I have definitely had better, and think that the placement of the sauce combination cheat sheet could have been better. (I didn't see it until I had already handed over my bowl for grilling). Having been to other Mongolian grills, I was able to put together something tasty, but if I had actually gone by the sauce guideline board, I would have felt comfortable trying something different. I went with veggie-only because I wasn't all that impressed with the meat presentation. The meal was alright, nothing spectacular and nothing foul. I'd give it a C-.

mDpEQsXwK_jyaWW95vaUng.text: Just tried YC's for the first time and already know there will be a second and third times to come. The staff showed me how it worked and I was amazed at the selection and just how much food could fit in the large bowl. YC's is awesome!

wWS1nUwQ5OPZ4xicTXWPTA.text: Pretty typical Mongolian grill joint where they cook the food in front of you. Large variety of tofu, meats, and vegetables to pile into your bowl. Many different choices of sauces to pour over your items. If you go for dinner, you will get soft serve ice cream to go with your meal. Staff is pretty friendly and helpful.

yFL-4lh1GM_dEO3bZNlwpw.text: YC's is a pretty cool place to go.  Here's how it works: you get a bowl and you fill it up with anything you want, including sprouts, broccoli, carrots, onions, peppers, scary dehydrated meat and much more.    After all your ingredients are in your bowl, you then get to choose the sauces you want to put in it.  They have suggestions and recipes for you to follow, from sweet to super spicy. Or you can always make up your own.   Then the chef's wok it up for you and pour it all back into your bowl.  You can add some rice to it, sesame seeds or any other toppings that you want and choose a table to sit at.   My only warning is to vegetarians- you must ask the cook to clean off the grill before cooking yours because if you don't, you will get little pieces of meat in your bowl that have been left on the grill from someone else's meal!

iXGvQ6RYvXpt4GK2B0gZdA.text: I know I only have myself to blame, because I've ate at Flattop Grill in Chicago which is the same concept - except it was like $15 all you can eat whereas this place was a little more.  (Somehow whatever I make at these places doesn't come out very well!)  Anyway, the concept is cool, but its not worth the premium charge they put on the options there.  I'd rather just go to a buffet that has something like this so its optional and its not your whole meal - and you can eat other things that doesn't come out all sucky.  :)

2KSByjhhe_ttGHBM7RTDwg.text: I work right down the street from YC's, but strangely it took me almost 2 years to actually try it out. I am glad I did! For $8 (including tax!) you can pile your bowl high with meat, veggies and noodles, then you get to play chef and make up your own sauce. I always have leftovers to take home for another meal which is a bonus. The price also includes a drink, won ton chips, soup and rice if you like. The food always appears fresh, which is a major plus. The only downside to this place, is if you hit it during a rush, you might have to wait awhile to get your food cooked....but it is worth the wait!

-yFgHO_DTXDbufv18werSw.text: I found Y.C.'s Mongolian BBQ to be decent, but not great. I'd go back, but it wouldn't be my first choice. That said, it's pretty good for Asian food in the greater Phoenix area. I've noticed a trend when it comes to people rating Asian food on Yelp! Those people from the area seem to rate the food much better than those people that are transplants. I was excited to try this place because it was a "mongolian bbq," however it doesn't hold a candle to the B.D.'s Mongolian BBQ in Royal Oak, MI where I'm originally from.

qXjTWyWOHBvN-dkud9jAew.text: This place is great, all you can eat including a drink and frozen yogurt for $11 is hard to beat.  Everything looked fresh and none of the toppings looked like they had been sitting for more than a few minutes.  Cooking time is short and you can go back as often as possible.  Highly recomend for a quick bite that is good and filling

IGJ8GP1cDqNczQvvidA69A.text: I have been here a couple of times for Lunch. At first I had no idea why my friends were telling me to pack the meat so tightly into the bowl. I soon found out when we got to the huge scorching hott metal "grill? wok?" whatever it is my food came out delicious. The portions you get for 7 or 8 bucks are colossal! I'm talking Lunch, Dinner and a late night snack.......MMMM good

6Opj9rrjSp96Mf_hlVukCg.text: There is a lot of variety of ingredients for you to make your own noodle bowl.  Everyone can end up with exactly what they want.  They charge for kids meals by the age of the child, so you don't sped a fortune on a bowl for a 3 year old.

fD0tySMXP1dOWShLpTkLeg.text: Some of the best food I've ever eaten. The portions are huge, so don't eat anytime before you go.  You pick your food out and they cook it right in front of you, plus there is always soup and rice and pineapple to have on the side. You get a drink included. It's packed on weekend nights, especially since there's a classic car show right out front.

1cdhGmRIuG97iB6hjZcw8w.text: If I could give it a negative number I would!  I swear people in Phoenix have NO TASTE! This place sucked BADLY!!!  You make your bowl, you put your sauce on, but where the heck are the spices? That's not even the worst part.  The worst part is they use water to cook the food and wash off all the sauce you put on.  Bland, bland, bland.  I'm from the mid-west and we know food.  You know the kind that sticks your ribs that actually has this thing called "FLAVOR"!  If you want a good mongolian place to eat, spend the money and eat at BD's Mongolian BBQ.  You have soooo much to choose from and you can even have a salad.  Pros: There isn't any unless you haven't eaten in weeks.  Cons: No flavor. Wash the little taste off. Felt sick after eating there. Tons of water in the bowl. Smelled like a toilet.

4r-o3fcfKtPdmFA0DclvdA.text: nice selection of meats and vegetables and sauces.  no msg. healthy. can load up lots of food.

XUaN_QGnqfvqir9-vGWwaw.text: This place ROCKS!!!  The food is always great...I love the different sauces you can use to create your own masterpiece.  The young staff is verry attentive and friendly.  A great place for a healthy, low cost meal

4veZa0bdwVnK7tPXN0nzdg.text: For fast casual stir fry, YC's can't be beat. 6 things you should know before you go:  1. You pay first, and you can pay $0.50 for a to-go box. You'll want to do this. While your wallet is out, grab some cash now- and/or tip by card when you initially pay.   2. You'll be building your own bowl full of delish down a buffet-style line setup, so parents beware you'll want a free hand to help the shorter members in your fam.   3. There's a box of tissue papers at the start of the line; you'll want to grab one so you can smash down the ingredients as you fill your bowl because everything cooks down and you've already paid for a to-go box.   4. The sauces are all fantastic- and you can tweak them to your preference and mood. If you want to really take the flavor up a notch, let the impressive saucier skills of the staff on the floor help craft your sauce on-the-fly by asking you your preferences. There's always someone there to help before you get to the fun part.   5. Place your towering bowl on the counter to be stir fried and enjoy the show! That cash from earlier can be tucked in theIr tip jars here. If you tipped by card earlier, great.   6. Don't forget to add one or two soups, white or brown rice, and an included drink!   The staff is always great! This location is one of the better ones for sure!

XwyLZ1QmbUSv3MEBz72dgw.text: Amazing time! Thanks to Ben for helping us out with making such an amazing Mongolian style noodle bowl! Thanks YC's!!!

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing time at YC &#39;s Mongolian Grill!! Thanks to Ben for showing us the master way of a great Mongolian style noodle bowl!! Excellent time!

lKKFsZCvEvwXIL9ULue-Hw.text: This place is a stir fye restaurant.  The price is right!   They offer small and large bowls.  The all you can eat is $1 more.  The only real downside is the long lines at peak time but it wasn't that bad.  You pack your meat first into the bowl.  The meat is freeze dried beef, chicken or fresh fish.  Shrimp can be added for ~$1 more    I got AYCE but was full on a large bowl.  You an also get brown or white rice, those crispy things end beverages.  They have soft serve ice cream for desert.   We went on a busy Saturday night.  It was a younger crowd but also families like us.  I highly recommend it.  It was about $60 for my family of four.

V4XyAIMv7_u446uNLQSySQ.text: Woooooo doggy I'll tell you what, this place has THE best beans and mash I ever tasted. If you want a good place to kick the ol boots up and hang your hat this is the place to be.   That lady Christy had a nice wagon on her, reminded me of the times I used to go out west.   Yee haw

iOm0GdWOHpcOD8CGH0VSrg.text: I've been coming to YC's for about 8 years now and I have to say it always exceeds my expectations. I love being able to pack my bowl as high as I want so I have extras to take home. (I always tell my friends that the leftovers are equally as good as getting it fresh). I always try to bring new people here so they can experience how amazing this place really is. The service, food and staff are all perfect. Ben was especially helpful in making my sauce for me and clearing our table out with such a great attitude.   All in all anyone who gives this place less than 5 stars is a fool   Thank you YC's!!!!

Everyone that works there is very nice and helpful. I'll keep coming back as long as I live here!

Such a great place with fantastic food and a phenomenal staff.  GO check it out!!

BNOVRo0dGIncKyjk3AnJ1Q.text: Holy smoke! This place sucks! It's like the Old Country Buffet of Mongolian Grill joints. Food was totally mediocre. And that's giving them a compliment. The two "cooks" took our food, threw it on the hot iron then took our sauce / seasoning. Put that on top then dumped a gallon of water on it, pushed it around for a minute and gave it to us. It was horrible! Flavorless and totally undercooked. The rice they offered looked like it was a week old and cold. My potatoes were still raw. I had to go back to the sauce and spice collection to get any flavor on my meal at all. Won't be back. Waste of money. Was there for the Saturday night car show. I now know the reason why McDonald's was so busy. Next time I'll wait in line there, its way more worth the time and money.

You then come to a sauce bar and you follow the directions to create the flavor that goes into the food.  Take your tray to the cooks and they do their magic and cook it all up.   Good quality food, easy to put together if you read directions.   $12.95 includes one trip bowl, soup, drink and ice cream cone.   Not five stars only because you have to pay .50 for your to go container.   Give me a try.

T_5ygfnwTlGQoV88T-xr8A.text: I love stir fry, and I must say, the staff here are super friendly and helpful, but this restaurant is unique. It's like buffet style stir fry, except you only get to go to the buffet once. And if you don't know that your bowl needs to be super filled and overflowing with the ingredients, it cooks up into just a very small dinner. Also, don't forget sauce, or sesame oil, or both, or it cooks wrong, because they only cook it with water.... however, if you follow the recipe screen, you could put it together nicely. Overall, the restaurant is not very clean, the tables were all super dirty and I had to clean ours with baby wipes. The baby seats roll and are not cleaned-- so moms beware. ZmLM4k6Tg51Dz14eO1bwOA.text: We went around 830 pm on a Friday evening, Ordered the Unlimited. So Go up for 2nd serving don't finish it all. Ask for a 2 go box they tell me NO. WTH I Paid The Extra. I feel this should be disclosed before paying for extra.

X-rzzkJfdFNpvWRkPsEvmw.text: $11.50- Big ass bowl, drink, ice cream, rice, and soup. $12.50- Big ass bowl (unlimited), drink, ice cream, rice, and soup.  Random spouting off prices, I know.  This is all that I kept hearing about the group I was with.  I had no idea what was in store for me.  And then we arrived.  Since I drove, I didn't have to pay (score!).  I was just told to grab a bowl, grab some wax paper, and stuff- HARD!  It just didn't make sense, until I was watching what was happening.  After I saw tons of meats (I think I stuffed the bowl 3/4 with meat), I didn't get too many vegetables, as I just really wanted meat and noodles.  Then next I stacked it with a mix of rice and wheat noodles- I was living dangerously.    Then next up, there is an area that you can make your own sauces (they have like 20-30 to choose from!).  I highly suggest dousing your bowl with liquids, as the pic suggests this stuff is cooked at high heat.  I regret not putting more sauce on mine.  Then when you are complete, you hand to a cook and they heat it up for you.  That is when you get extra rice, soup, and your drink.  The stuff comes out pretty quickly.  Then pick a spot and enjoy.  My beef/pork/noodle combo was pretty good, and was excited of the concoction.  Keep in mind this place is a trial and error type of place, and its up to you to find out what flavors work for you- I think that is unique for a place like this.  You can also get some shrimp, but it costs extra.

ubfM7KWQwyA0swUHXFw3Og.text: Yum! Quick! Yum! More food than you would even think! Lots of great seating

9RCfh9ftqdDoqEqZND5Pmg.text: I love this location. Our Saturday night routine involves the car show and YC's. Service is always great regardless of how busy they are. All Ingredients are always available, the grill staff always friendly and accommodating. For the amount of food you can get, the price great.

L0evD6R3Hs7qcc4lmyUB1A.text: I have been coming here since they opened, decades ago.  I believe this is the longest standing restaurant at the Pavillions (now Talking Stick).  On my visit last weekend, I witnessed a mother and daughter (in front of me in line) abusing the staff, breaking the rules, and being all around nasty people.    They had ordered the small bowl (which is plenty of food for even the largest of appetites), but began smashing literally pounds and pounds of meat with another bowl, and was politely told that using a second bowl to smash food is a no-no.  She reacted extremely rudely and continued doing it.  When the employee noticed her, he politely reminded her that it was against the rules.  At this point, her bowl is stacked 20 hands high, food is falling on the floor and all over the counter, and she continues adding more and more food... she yells at the employee "you're harassing me, you don't need to tell me again, stop it! Stop it!  Stop it!  You're harassing me!".  He offered her money back but she got angrier.  If it were me, I would have dumped her tray into the trash and tossed her out.    So, my lunch was spent sitting across from this horrible woman watching her eat herself to death.  My advice to the staff--don't let these people bully you.

GXUsMN1gnvTyG8mcXfPxcA.text: First time at YC's today.  I had been to others, years ago, so I was hopeful it would be just as good. It wasn't. The front register is so close to the door that after ONE person walks in, the rest have to line up outside.   On to the food:  Hot and sour soup wasn't hot or sour. Definitely mediocre and needed strong shots of vinegar and hot sauce, which weren't in sight. For the Mongolian BBQ portion, the peanuts were whole, which makes no sense. Not chopped?  Also the sweet and sour sauce was so thin it just missed the mark. The main portions were fine, with good selections of proteins, veggies and sauces.   For ambiance: The TV had still pics of customers and was generally boring. In other words, no ambiance.   I can't recommend YC's at this point but I always give a place two tries, just in case they had an off day.

IjJDC5zcIHzcuBf5BjQdeg.text: We tried this place on a whim.  It was excellent!  An extensive selection of fresh veggies and sauces.  We took half home.

dO4ZRcLAwHzIJGKo8G19bg.text: Great Concept!! The food was delicious and the customer service was great. I have never been to one of these before and the girl at the front gave me a quick run down of how it worked. Then another gentleman helped me at the sauce station by finding out what I liked and making it based off that. I will definitely be returning for more in the near future.

rUyccS2tAgXPIJf7c82Qqg.text: YC's is by far the best Mongolian grill and this location is my favorite! You have a variety of meats and vegetables to choose from, the food line is always stocked and everything is extremely fresh! They are very accommodating if you have any food allergies- they even have coconut aminos in substitute for soy sauce. Ben is always present, very helpful and ensuring everyones satisfied! Stack your bowl high and give it a try because it always turns out delicious.

-K_M7XHcTOv57SWN38OpWw.text: Let me start out by saying that this is the first negative review I've ever felt compelled enough to write after eating at hundreds of restaurants with my girlfriend. Also, as a server for multiple years I know what it takes to give good service. I visited with my girlfriend at 8pm, on October 23rd. I had already eaten dinner and was just going for a quick bite for my girlfriend after her shift at work. We go in and get greeted by a tired sounded host. I still gave him a 20 percent tip because I know how hard work can be sometimes. The total came out to 16 dollars! 16 dollars seems a little pricey for chicken and noodles but it's okay because it was only place nearby and she was hungry. After sitting down and letting her eat a bit, I get a fork to try a bite of her food. Once again, I already ate so I'm not hungry just wanted a bite and I get told, "if you want to buy a bowl you can but don't eat off hers. WTF. The only time I am spoken too for my 20 percent tip is an inconsiderate comment about not be able to try my girlfriends food I paid for. Again I work in the food industry and I know sometimes there's bs rules but there has to be a better way to word that to someone who just tipped you. Ex, I'm sorry to say this sir but company policy says you can't share food, thank you. Well I was offended and my girlfriend knew so she just asked for a box. The same 'friendly man' let's her know that we usually have to charge for this but just this once he will give it to her for free. Like what. This is a consumer world so I urge all the consumers reading this to take your money elsewhere where it is valued. Believe me, I live in this area and there are about a million other places that treat you better than this. And you get more food at a cheaper price! Never again.  UPDATE: the owner has reached out and offered to make it up to me for the visit. I'm impressed with how quick they responded.  UPDATE: I finally decided to give the place a second shot and it was awesome!!!! The staff was super friendly and helped accommodate with sauces. I left my original review because I think it's important to learn from their mistakes.

t5RuncjiQmlOCMGBfiQs7g.text: Holy Cow!  I am so impressed.  They have Mongolian down to an art form.  When I walked in, I explained that it was our first time there.  She explained how everything worked and even told us that for .50 extra we could take our food home in a to go box.  I was super excited because most of the time, my eyes are bigger than my stomach and I end up wasting half my meal.    The food was super fresh and delicious.  They even have someone to help you get the right sauce combination to ensure that your meal is done exactly right.  Rice and soup is included in your dinner.  Still hungry after?  They have frozen yogurt to satisfy your sweet tooth.  My family loves this place and we will definitely be back as often as possible.  SO HAPPY!!!!

EVy3eHRs6TyYPi2gg_VO0w.text: This is probably one of my favorite places to go to in order to eat large amounts of meat. I use my whole body weight to smash down the meat into the bowl and then flip he meat sideways to make a wall to hold even more meat before adding vegetables and noodles on top. The selection of spices and marinades is quite impressive. I suggest not only getting two containers of flavor but to add it into the dish itself to give all he flavor you need to combat he heavy amount of meat. Muahahaha!  Another thing of note is that the bowls of food also come with drinks, soup, and rice on the side. During dinner hours it may come with unlimited ice-cream. After you finish eating you can pay for a to-go container for $0.50 to take the excess amounts of food home for another meal or two.

AxcTtiE4ySEUlKNOKDGPAA.text: I really like this place! me and my dad go on the same side and mix and match our favorite pastas, I sometimes get 6 scoops of garlic! you watch them cook your food, while your waiting, you can get other small dishes. super place, a god hangout for a family reunion.

6VpqsPrZhJ-QjsXMXxuSLA.text: You can make your own bowl! Lots of veggies, different meats, noodles, 2 broths, white or brown rice and they cook the food for you! You choose the sauces! It is a big bowl too for $14 unlimited! Pretty damn good :)

g2JPqYDAKKRS0HTU-fFN7g.text: The food was awesome, very delicious and flavorful. Great choices for veggies, dry spices and sauces. I love how they even have a large board telling you how to combine sauces to make different ones.

bTmGNwM-2HRhS5dl9wTJ4Q.text: My family and I normally go to the one in Tempe and now I remember why. We went there Tuesday and we should have left as soon as we walked in. The cashier had the worst attitude and was extremely rude. We notified her that my husband has a gluten allergy well of course when we get to the grill the cook was less than pleased that he had to clean the grill for my husband and gave us a dirty look. If you are going to serve potatoes you must at least part cook them because we all added them to our bowls and they were raw. The soups were cold and gross, the red pepper flakes were so old that they were no longer red, who knows how long it's been there for. Cleanliness is definitely not a priority here. Had a hard time finding a table because they were dirty. My husband and brother had the all you can eat. My brother completely lost his appetite on his second bowl. You could see burnt specs on it and it smelled burnt really bad. I tasted it and had to spit it out because it was so gross. When I told the manager he just proceeded to make excuses about how maybe the grill hadn't been cleaned or that maybe my brother had added too much sauce. Then he finally admitted that the cook must have poured water on the hot grill and it removed all the burnt on old sauce and now cooked it into my brothers food. Then when I tell him about how rude the cashier was and how each time she walks by our table she gave me a dirty look. He said well she's just a bit dry, I said no she was flat out rude. He said yeah well I guess I can mention it to her. I went back and have read countless reviews about the rude staff. Wonder why this location doesn't care about customer service. To top it off my husband got extremely sick surely from the cook doing a shitty job at cleaning the grill and from all the sauce cross contamination. Definitely will never be back at this location.

lOsdn6erau2wnZGCkqVZzQ.text: Decided to try this place out as I have been past it hundreds of times and never been in.   The concept is really cool, where they have buffet style tables with endless ingredients and topping that you mix and match to make your own stir fry bowl.   The first thing I noticed, unlike other businesses they encourage you to make your bowl as big as you can make it at one set price, even offering wax paper to condense your ingredients to make more room. They are all about feeding you here. and if you feel overwhelmed like I did, there is friendly staff happy jump in and help.  It's a fast food style set up, where you get your food and go sit down to eat, however the staff running around cleaning tables are making sure you have everything you need and even refilling your drinks so you dont have to get up.  Overall the food is amazing and I will definitely be back to try different combos, but what really blew me away was the service. Highly recommend

q0fNi5irGrD8SN9WkD0C-g.text: At first, I was taken back by the $12+ price tag for a bowl of food at a fast casual place. But then, I started peeling back the layers and really found this place to be super family friendly and full of extras.  For the cost of a large bowl, you also get a bowl of rice, bowl of soup, a drink and a frozen yogurt. To say I could've gotten a smaller bowl was a large understatement, but DO NOT get a small bowl. I repeat, do not get a small bowl. For just a single dollar more (and $.50 for the cost of a to-go box... so $1.50), you have a full lunch for the next day! And okay, if you have a smaller appetite, the smaller bowl would give you that as well.   The best part though and something I've not seen at any other restaurant EVER is how they price their kid meals. They base the cost based on age. My kids eat just about nothing, so taking them here and having to pay $5/each would have been a deal breaker. BUT, instead they charge $.55 per year of age, making my 3yo's meal (with the rice, drink, soup and frozen yogurt too!) is only $1.65. My 5yo's meal is only $2.75. Now we're talking.  I wish they had some sort of reward's club or something, but regardless, I'm excited about finding this place. The people were nice and helpful when it came to choosing sauces and the sauces were labeled with vegetarian and gluten free labeling (which is great because I am definitely the V).   We will be back, especially on my birthday when I get a free meal for signing up for emails!

oiqteLmHou53Dr0Si2-_tw.text: Skip the ballpark food, and get your grub on here after the game. Amazing customer service, and a Mongolian grill where they actually encourage squishing down the ingredients in your bowl if you want. About $13 for the big bowl, $14 ish for AYCE. I had a big bowl, and could only finish about half. Soda, tea, soup, rice included in the price. Worth the money.

Qy6vNt7JQIVvuwZRUzPcXw.text: Cool idea for a restaurant. You decide what size bowl you want and pay, then go through a buffet of frozen/chilled veggies, meats, noodles, etc. you then add sauce (the chalkboard has different recipes you can try). While they're cooking your bowl, you can decide if you want rice, additional garnishes, soup, etc. A drink is included, too! The staff is nice and accommodating, even during rushes. You get a ton of food if you stuff your bowl full, and can take some home for leftovers.  The food was good, but not crazy amazing. It was similar to other Mongolian BBQ places.  Tips:  -use the parchment paper to squash your food down so you can fit more! -even if the line stretches out the door, don't run away! The line moves fast, and the wait is worth it!

bte3XAN3ysG8im_7tkyAcg.text: Just figured out we've been going there for almost 18 years...wow. I perfected my sauce recipe about 17 years ago (though I have had to tone done the chili oil as I've gotten older and wimpier...) This is a fun place to bring out of town folks - won't break the bank, if anyone leaves hungry, it's their fault.  Staff is helpful, food is plentiful, tasty, and you can make it as healthy as you choose to. I think that's the only place besides the McDonalds that's been there for the whole time we've been going to the Pavilions. If you haven't been on a Saturday night to go to the weekly car show, go early, grab dinner at YC's, then check out the cars.  Cheap date for the whole family!  (or go to a movie afterwards) Hoping to go there for at least another 18 years.  :-)

LYCdSZrsoHm-0C-jl956IQ.text: This is a neat stir fry place with a design-your-own approach. They have a nice variety of meat, vegetables and sauces you can create for your meal.  The place is well maintained and looks pretty modernized. The line may look crowded as you first walk in, but it moves pretty fast. For a place with a good cooked-to-order meal, it's still less of a wait than if you sat down to dine.   The meat shrinks during cooking, so make sure you get a double portion. There is an option for a 50 cent take out container, if you strategize and pile high enough (use wax paper at the start of the line to pack down the food) its petty easy to get enough for a second meal for later.  Words of caution though-the rice noodles are harder to stack, get wheat noodles if you have your heart set on seconds. Also, the entire bowl comes out very very hot at first when you sit down,   Edit: I was originally perplexed to see the chicken frozen in rolls, but received a message from the owner who thoughtfully described the preparation to plate process, to create fresh chicken pieces that are ready to easily be cooked the day after they are received. Now I am even more sold on this place.  .

72hfaqL4RL_t7g1wszGe6A.text: I have been coming to YCs since I moved to the Valley in 1999 and I plan to keep coming back. They do a great job! My wife has been coming here since 1993!  It's super basic in concept fantastically nuanced in execution: just load up your favorite proteins, veggies, and noodles in a bowl, add your own custom made sauce then hand the whole thing off to a chef that quickly cooks your custom bowl!   Add soups, wontons, rice, a drink, ice cream, etc. Lots of food!!!  I am no mathematician but I met there are something between a million and an infinite number of choices in making your bowl.  So delicious.   Options for small, Large, and unlimited bowl at lunch and dinner pricing. To go orders are also accommodated.   Staff keeps the place super clean which is harder than it sounds with as many people working their magic while crafting the perfect bowl.  Ben, the Manager, is awesome.  You watch him taking care of every group in the place like they were the only guests!  Really a nice thing to experience particularly in a fast casual dining experience.

Uy5XnUQwW30zMgf7R3bFIA.text: I'm from the Northwest and I was really hoping this would be similar to HuHot. YC's just didn't compare, a lot less ingredient and sauce options (about half of what HuHot offers) and it felt more "fast food" than a restaurant. What ingredients they do have looked quality and fresh though. You get soup, chips, rice, and a soda with your noodles for about $13 so the prices were very reasonable for what they do offer. The soups (a beef soup and a chicken veggie soup) did not look appetizing so I skipped on that.  An employee does the sauces for you and followed recipes which kind of took away from the fun of creating your own dish and being able to add what you like. Overall the dish was okay but nothing remarkable flavor wise. Was really looking for more bold flavors you find in traditional Mongolian sauces.  Compared to other Mongolian restaurants I have been to this was just not as authentic seemed very "fast food" vibe with the interior layout and decor. Even the cooking time was really fast- nice if you're in a hurry but not great for quality of food.

JM-AfhYQj6CCgjygrllEOA.text: Another awesome experience at YC's today!  I live pretty far from here, but if ever I'm in the area, I make it a point to stop in.  I always loved the kids meal being pay by the age, but to our surprise, our kids were actually FREE today and every Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday!  Food is always delicious, the cooks are rock stars and the team as a whole was insanely attentive, polite and hospitable!

EBijeXv3SH5xPtxQse6L3A.text: This place was awesome!!! My fiance and I came for a quick little date night away from work and wedding plans and we loved it. Great food and awesome value!! The customer service was incredible. We will absolutely be coming back.

6TaEKWvaJ25zV9jHNpD6Tg.text: I stopped by here this past Wednesday evening with my wife, her parents and her brother for dinner.  The inside of YC's Mongolian looks like like most Mongolian restaurants with a large buffet like bar, a couple of circular grills and then some seating.  How YC's differs from our Mongolian Grills back in Pittsburgh is that their meat is frozen and they also have mixed sauce suggestions.  If you have never been to a Mongolian grill before the premise is simple.  You are given a bowl that you fill up with whatever meats, vegetables and carbs that you want.  Then you pair a sauce with it and it gets cooked on the grill and handed back to you.  On this occasion I went with the unlimited bowl while my wife went with the large bowl.  All of my trips produced very similar items in the fact that I got chicken, beef, water chestnuts, broccoli, cauliflower, bell peppers and pineapple.  The only differences between my bowls were the sauces as I twice went with Thai peanut curry and once missed their spicy sauce all while adding chili oil to each. All three times I ended up enjoying my bowl.  It's nice to be able to customize it to your own personal preferences.  By the time I left the restaurant I was incredibly satisfied and stuffed.  Then within an hour of finishing eating I had some issues and my wife had different issues the next morning.  Can I prove that they were YC's fault?  Nope I cannot, however, I have my suspicions.    The bottom line for me is that I probably wouldn't come to YC's again in the future.  While I was happy and satisfied with the food while I was there, I certainly wasn't later in the evening turning a 4 star review into 3 stars.  UPDATE:  The owner of YC's contacted me on Yelp the day after my review was posted .  He let me know that he was glad that we enjoyed our meal but sorry that we had issues afterward and that they take food safety seriously.  He also gave me a number to contact him.  That alone should show you that the owner does care about his establishment and what goes on their and gives me a much more favorable view of YC's.

evJuGrJv-i5t3FX9jtBZNA.text: I came in today after my sons practice and I like the food but the manager was actually amazing! He was helpful attentive and actually cared about his customers. He didn't assume my son was not a child and asked, made sure his drink was refilled and made us feel comfortable while we sat and ate! Very much appreciated!

2LL_oH1j9XY3Y_v9LHsIFw.text: Probably one of the best Mongolian grills I have been to. I love the food here and the service. lVfhEHXonJr3vG8AWK43BQ.text: We LOVE YC's! Attentive and helpful staff, amazing food and very clean. 9I5VQWdcC1QmL_8r-6am-g.text: Thanks Ben for all your help! With it being my first time at this establishment I didn't know what to do with the buffet set-up but Ben was right there to walk me through it and set up my plate for me! They also had a vegan option which was amazing and the dining area was well kept. The employees were amazing. And the food was soooo good! Can't wait to come back!

3zGWMW_i1_6Yqo7bAVP8Kg.text: Dear YC's,  I have a confession. I cheated on you.. with Genghis Grill near Arrowhead Towne Center. I promise you, it meant nothing to me. Actually, it made me appreciate you even more. As we silently ate our flavorless bowls we thought about you the whole time. We missed your large portions and comforting smells. I also missed your lower prices. Your sauce selection is perfect and I love how your meats are frozen and thinly sliced. I never had a problem filling my bowl with your fresh vegetables and delicious meats, but had to try Genghis because it is closer to my house. I will never make that mistake again.. I will drive to you, happily. Will you forgive me? We will never, ever stray again. In the world of Mongolian BBQ, you are everything to me.   Yours Truly,  Kevin   PS- you should open a location near the 101/17.. there are tens of thousands of us up here that would appreciate it.

q7bOUW4v4Gx_gvsl7MaldA.text: Great tasting food and a very large selection to choose from. First time here and didn't know what to expect. Filled up a bowl from a large selection of meats, veggies and noodles. Then I got to the sauces and man were there choices. One of the employees helped me out with choosing a sauce and she actually custom made a sauce for me. Then you go and have the cook grill your bowl. Matthew was our cook and did a phenomenal job. Everything was cooked to perfection and it was cool to watch. Will definitely be back soon.

bU9u77UUbh7PRGciiXYd2w.text: I've spent years out in other states devouring their takes on Mongolian BBQ, and yet for some reason YC's takes the cake. Everywhere I've gone defaulted to an AYCE style, so color me surprised when the best I've had was largely single order/take out.  If you aren't familiar with the format, you prepay for either a small or large bowl, so you don't have to worry about check at the end. You start with sliced meats, that they graciously provide paper to smash it all down and maximize space. You can dry spice if you want, then follow up with plenty of vegetables. What impressed me about YC's is the option of multiple noodles - after dozens of iterations, this is the only one with anything outside egg noodles - and the udon, rice, and wheat are all kickass! Then you finish off your sauce mixture in a separate bowl and you're off to the races.  I've tried the all you can eat out of habit a couple times, and I've found it not worth it. The norm is basically stacking your bowl as high as physically possible, with some of the most impressive bowls over twice the height you start with! When you get a quick stir fry from a bowl that big, with rice, soup, wontons, and ice cream at dinner, a large is actually ridiculously filling.  Not only am I a fan of their wheat noodles, but their sauce selection is straight up the best. With options like lemongrass, black pepper sauce, and Spicy Hunan on top of your regular selection, you can create something that can hit pretty much any flavor palate.   When all my friends in high school kept inviting me to go to YC's, I passed out of sheer ignorance. Never again will I give up a chance at some of the best tasting and valued Asian food in Scottsdale period.

kfr8pVloHFsnhG4ZVS8YDg.text: My favorite place to eat. I am begging the owner please open a west valley location I been calling this out for many years.   Answer my prayer MR YC OWNER.. WE NEED WEST VALLEY GLRNDALE/PEORIA AREA

kJHIET6as_L2ICBzEAJIUA.text: For about $12 you get a huge portion of customized stir fry and fountain drink for lunch. You can put as much frozen, raw slices of meat and fresh veggies as you want into your bowl and they cook it for you on a large, flat circular grill. The wait is usually no more than 8-10 minutes. YC's is excellent. I've visited many times over the years around the holidays. I usually eat as much as I can at the restaurant and when I fail to eat it all, I buy a to-go container for $0.50 for the leftovers.  It's too bad they haven't resolved the whole sharing or to-go issue after two decades. I'm sad to hear that the employees have been rude and/or confrontational to customers - especially to those who have kids that simply don't eat very much or to people who have much better portion control than myself. They've never been rude to us.  I've never gotten sick (I feel for those who have gotten seriously ill). I think they do a good job with keeping the meat shavings/rolls frozen at a safe temperature. It's seriously the best looking meat selection I've seen at Mongolian Grill places. Depending on who goes before you in the line, the veggies and sauce can get really messy. I've spilled sauces and dropped veggies all over the counter. Usually, the employees are quick to wipe the counters clean. For food safety reasons, remember to get a sheet or two of the wax paper at the beginning of the line. One to push down the raw meat in your bowl. And another sheet to push down your veggies. And please don't let the veggie tongs or your own fingers come into contact with the contents of your bowl.  Make sure you wash your hands before eating if you are especially susceptible to food illness.  I agree with another reviewer's comment that the hot and sour soup was weak. I feel like it has been better in past years. The rice is so-so. The crispy wonton strips are nice crunchy addition to either your soup or stir fry.  Don't forget to check out the cilantro, peanuts, and other toppings right before you give over your bowl to the cooks.  If you have any food allergies, like a peanut allergy, then this is not the place for you.

AQCt_tmGilDGKY6bRvrg1Q.text: Love this place! Been eating there since I moved to AZ in 1998. It's consistently delicious, and the best bang for your buck around! Wonderful, friendly, accommodating staff, always willing to help with sauce selection or bowl preparation. Ben is the best!

YJd6BpsaKLpNJzENHoDgiw.text: I asked a CSR at Home Depot where I should eat and he tells me "you've got to try this Mongolian BBQ next door." I'm a little skeptical, but it was late and I was starving so I thought "what the heck".  What a pleasant surprise! I was greeted by the friendliest hostess who explained the whole concept to me. So as I go to pay, I tell her I'd like a soda with it and she tells me soup, rice, entree, bevarage and dessert are included for $10! Oh my gosh, what a deal!  She then walked me through the whole process right to the point of handing my concoction to the fellow that was going to cook it. Unlike what I had anticipated, she encouraged me to add MORE stuff... she wanted to make sure I got enough to eat.  I mixed it all with the Calcutta Curry and it came out great. Be careful though, the first several bites are steaming hot! Flavor was very good and I was a happy camper. The Manager, Peter (very nice guy), took time to sit with me and talk about the concept and make sure I was happy with my meal.  All in all I would really recommend trying this. Such a great concept, plentiful and good food, priced right and very friendly staff.

hZ1kVTdBLOFDdyPqMaMJcA.text: Unique, healthy and delicious.  If you want to try something different in the quick service space, this place is a must!  Lots of choices among meats and veggies, great variety of sauces, all cooked up on a big Asian wok...you'll love it!

jQ_-8B91eus-l8s4CWbZ8w.text: A new experience, in the end it was nasty, sauces were bland, and had massive diarrhea after wards.   RATING: GARBAGE!

ElEgS_JQgj5XVzRxSVcI3A.text: I get really excited about YC's Mongolian BBQ. I love the concept, prices, and how quick it is on a busy night. They also help you choose your sauces which can be rather confusing if you dont know what you are doing. I am a picky eater so it is nice that i get to pick everything that goes into my bowl. Also, you really get a ton of food.   No complaints, well maybe that there isnt one close to me.   Check it out!

AVsoUK7rkLBc6bMTftV3-Q.text: I've been going here regularly for about 12 years.  Always amazed me that YC's was able to stay open when everything else around them was closed for several years.  The great food is what kept people coming back.  It seems like the prices have gone up and at the same time the bowls have gotten smaller, but you can still pack as much as you want into the bowl and still not be able to eat all of it.

PSIz_vWbR7nPsm0V9uFYPA.text: Doing a happy dance!  YC'S used to be one of my favorite spots to grab a quick meal, until , about 10yrs. ago when  I found out the mystery behind all of my illness was food allergies to wheat, corn and cow dairy.  I tried to eat there and just use my GF Tamari, but there was still the issue of the grills having too much residue from other meals.  Recently my daughter informed me they had made a big change in handling special allergy needs and she was excited for me to go there.  If you deal with food allergies you will understand my skepticism, so, it took some time before I managed to try it out.  I am here to tell you, it was fabulous!   They are SO incredibly accommodating and helpful.  The staff were all cheerfully helpful.  Everyone was knowledgeable and aware of ingredients and respectful of my needs. The hostess put an allergy alert card on my tray and assured me I would be assisted with the sauces, which I Was. The grill cook was cleaning the grill before I even got to the counter.   He was cheerful and friendly,( and grinning at the fact that I was taking photos).  My food was beyond delicious! I had Panang Thai sauce, extra spicy.  They even have rice noodles!  I am So, so,so excited to be able to eat here again.  The perfect spot for before or after a movie, or to stop while shopping, or you know, if you just happen to be hungry for yummy stir fry done your way and don't want to do dishes.

YCaRdmV4TcYZCTomj5esvg.text: Squish food, thats what we call it, you walk in, pay for a small, medium or large bowl and a drink, go through the salad bar type line, picking out your meats and veggies, this is where the squish comes in, compressing the food in the bowl so you can fit more in, then take it to the grill and they cook it right in front of you, just make sure they don't drown it in water. V3QxBkVfcNa7TR7JH84BwA.text: I love this place! For an  extra buck you can get unlimited trips to the buffet, but lets face it, you are usually stuffed after just one trip. Great choice for people watching their carbs too, just lay off the noodles.

If you have any type of food allergies - this isn't the place for you... too many opportunities for cross contamination so stay away. I hadn't been here for a while but during my recent visit they have some staff there to help you mix your special blend of sauce for your food - great idea YC's. So many people get hung up here so this is a nice addition.  I also like this place because it's pretty quick to get through the line and start eating.

kftbllHQjooqtltO74Dm7w.text: I really really wished they had a place like this in cali.  southern cali specifically since I live in LA, cause we have nothing like this here and I am more the jealous.  This is basically a genghis khan self-service version + you get soup!!!  So the fun and excitement of this place is that you are able to pack your food into your bowl... as much as you want... whatever you want... however you want... including the meat!! USVSyXLXqxWmXwsoVpvLuA.text: Friendly service, good food at a great price. A quick and easy meal that keeps everyone in the family happy. The ice cream machine was a nice little bonus! The location wasn't great, in the middle of a strip mall with nothing to really offer before or after the meal.

ltSPKE9DvPaJbOQM-9iGxg.text: I have been coming here for years and years and years and years. Until a few years back they only deserved a 4 star but they have upped their game and this is still my favorite Mongolian BBQ I have ever had. The staff is nice, the quality is good and the portions are HUGE! You cannot go wrong with going to YC's. One of my favorite fast dining options in AZ.

NC3UVT5xsueRSuqY7yuFdA.text: I love this place. Unfortunately I don't live that close so have to make a special drive there when I get the craving for Mongolian bbq. I feel I'm pretty talented at getting the most food I can into that bowl. I get the white meat chicken, their choices are chicken-white or dark, beef, pork and Alaskan cod. The meat is lightly frozen and curled so when you put in the bowl you have to smash it down. Don't worry they have parchment paper there fire you too do this so your not touching raw meat. Then you choose all your veggies and off you want some seasoning. I always get a ton of bean sprouts, carrots and mushrooms but they have a lot of other veggie choices. Then choose your noodles rice, udon or wheat. I get a mixture of what and udon. I put the noodles on the bowl for the sauce because with all the goodies I load into my food bowl it's just too high otherwise. For my sauce I love to use the teriyaki recipe slightly modified, I leave out the oil and double the garlic and ginger accounts. I'm Italian can't have too much garlic and I love ginger. Then you bring it to the wok where they cook it. It's so freaking good. Then it comes with a drink, rice if you want and soup. I pass on the soup but always get a bowl of brown rice, it's yummy.  Just fyi 50 cents for takeout container which I always purchase cause I get the large bowl and my left others last at least 2 meals. They have soft serve ice cream for a dollar. I highly recommend this place. Wrong tone of the season but during spring training games at the salt river fields it's great to walk to after or before catching the game. I did this twice this year after watching an early DBacks game.

XDXxOZWcsCChEiUsdnQLMg.text: Usually the service is good but tonight we had a horrible experience. The workers kept giving my boyfriend a hard time for how he was filling up his bowl. (And laughing at him too for the way he was doing it. SO unprofessional) the cook kept giving my boyfriend dirty looks too. The cook didn't even property cook my meal correctly. My eggs were runny/mushy and my veggies were undercooked. And it's kind of ridiculous to charge for a to go box. Like I said, in the past we've always usually had a positive experience which is why I'm being generous giving 3 stars, but tonight was just not up to par with what we are use to and for that I'd rate it maybe a 2.

MSWJEMT0I7olQubPIwMSuw.text: I've been eating at this location for years. The staff have always been helpful and friendly. As much as I enjoy eating my food there, I enjoy it even more as cold leftovers the next day once the spice has fully settled into the meat. Well worth what you pay for. With the to-go box (sometimes I need two for my leftovers), I can get between 2-4 meals out of one trip here. The food quality is also good for the price and the flavor is up to you, so if you don't like the flavor, it's more on you than on them. Overall, this is a place I'd recommend.

zh0cyP2wLO4wNJcombw9IQ.text: I went here for the first time today for lunch. I have to admit, I was a Mongolian Grill virgin.  I walked in debating if I was even going to stay, but the cute little cashier convinced me to try it.  For just over $10 for a small bowl, I was ready to have my over-stuffed self rolled out of there.  I would like to say that the staff was pleasant like in other reviews, but I really had no interaction with them outside the cashier.  It was the customers ahead of me that taught me what to do (yeah, I'm a solo eater!).  It felt like a bit of camaraderie going on with patrons.  How cool is that?!  I am convinced that my kids would love this place, I just think they would not enjoy the food, make it themselves or not.  I will most definitely be back for lunch another day!

4k1XE-5VWNgsMxyx8LoABg.text: Love this place! Great food great price! What else you need? I don't think you will hear negatives comments about this place, maybe the process can make you hesitate, but is all about throw things to your plate and give it to some one else to cook it, yes, is that simple.

L67RCDg1Ktv9DwFm9togwQ.text: It's definitely a restaurant that's worth the money! Always remember to get a box to go because you will not finish if you pile your bowl like a pro. I love the extras they give you at the end to put on top of your completed bowl. Great place to eat!!

anHltNbCUOJaExEX1fMtbA.text: I Absolutely LOVE YC's!!! Unique experience and truly you could create something new to taste every time you go. We have been eating here for 15+ years! Worth every penny... My only complaint is that they don't have locations in the north valley.

eDwj27KumMEgYJmeOANfiw.text: This restaurant in the best around and I am not surprised it has lasted there for so long! I love how you can build your own meal and get a large amount of food  for the money! Their staff is very nice and always welcoming. Their original sauce is the way to go when you mix the sauces!

HnLC9tEy8CtPXYG2u3Bc0Q.text: My wife and I tried this place this evening.  The only reason I don't give it a 1-star rating is because neither of us died.  Otherwise, it was a poor experience and we won't be returning.  First, When we get our bowls and begin filling them up, there's no shrimp.  I ask about shrimp and am told it's $1 extra.  So, shrimp costs $1 extra from the $11.85 we each paid but you're forcing us to buy the ice cream and drink as part of the $11.85?  I should have asked if they can subtract $1 for each of our meals because neither of us wanted the ice cream and subtract another $2 from my wife's meal because she only drinks tap water.  Bottom line here, I resent that we're being forced to buy the extras as they're included in the price, but we're to be charged more if we want shrimp.  Hey, Genghis Grill down at Tempe Marketplace has shrimp on the bar and doesn't charge extra and doesn't force you to buy a drink and ice cream.  Second, the various sauces were poorly marked with bowls of sauces with no corresponding label or a label with no corresponding sauce.  There were even sauces that were obviously not what the corresponding label indicated.  It was difficult to know what we were putting with our bowls.  Third, my wife didn't finish all her bowl so she asked or a container to take it home.  They charged her $0.50 for a takeout box.  Seriously????  We won't return and will instead drive the extra 5 miles or so to the Genghis Grill at Tempe Marketplace the next time we want Mongolian BBQ.

CN4InXBEomUuEc6yfSQLeA.text: What? I am  supposed to go out of my house to a restaurant and then make my own dish? Well...the fact i am giving it 4 stars means im good at it :)  This place is amazing because of the large variety of meats, veggies, noodles and sauces and the experience every visit can bring. Takes just a few minutes and the serving size can be as enormous as your squishing abilities are. I have always ended up with enough leftover.  This place is great if you know what to do, its also great if you are the adventurous, experimental kind. If you mess it up, forgive yourself and be back! For me, i have found the recipe that works and i'm sticking to it!

iQOSHhZ-BpZt7s0IxVx6Uw.text: Great place for all types of diets including meat-eaters, vegetarians and vegans.  Some people that don't eat meat don't like how they cook everything on the same surface but I haven't heard of any other complaints.

P9kVCgEFYH3GGNChGZXp3A.text: Ben is awesome! Made sure everything was going smooth during the dinner rush and helped us out choosing a sauce. Have loved this place for as long as I can remember! Will definitely be back!!

jPeWiaYC9TNxik9HzMS3Ww.text: Food as always was amazing! Everything fresh especially the large options of veggies.  Service especially great.  Especially Kim who was courtesy, kind and made special efforts to help with sauce and our 18 month old.  Huge family hit!

_Ttd-E9vsRgjon8VjxTrLw.text: Ate here for lunch & the food was SOOO delicious. I've been to YC's many years ago but I don't remember it being this good. The employee named Calais H. was super nice and created a sauce for myself and my husband and they came out soo flavorful. I didn't get the names of everyone that helped us but they all gave such great customer service and were very attentive. I will definitely be returning and I highly recommend this location to everyone.

neRKp8mI3W0CIE-s-Qslrw.text: This place is amazing, every time I come in, the employees treat us with so much respect and also they know me cuz I come here THAT often haha but overall it's a great place, great atmosphere and amazing food. Will continue to come back every chance I get. 10/10 Tony's recommend this place.  Don't @me.

7IkUBH6dA0qsRbJXjK-EZA.text: This place is always the best! Great service from the crew cooking and management.
