Ab32i_jPM1M5R4Z_bbhRtw.text: As a first-timer, even after watching the online videos, etc., we were a little overwhelmed, but Kim did an outstanding job assisting us from the register on. Her recommendations and help mixing up the right sauce made for delicious, plentiful bowls. All of the staff were courteous, but Kim went above and beyond in welcoming us and ensuring that we enjoyed our dining experience. We will certainly be back!

uhXTTDOsbPDIngWwBrgSlw.text: Great service, the staff helps you out a lot with making a delicious bowl! I had no idea what to do and they took their time with me. Over all amazing food and cool environment!

8xeMa-jtapRYlsQcBp0_Dg.text: Build your own bowl! Many great options to include all types of veggies and meat selections. Great value for lunch which also includes soup and a drink. Friendly servers and hostess.

GxXOEFguPcvD12HLPkA_0A.text: I love this place. My wife and I always stop by after seeing a movie. The staff here are always so helpful. It's really cool to see how they cook the food. The food is also so amazing! For first timers make sure you ask the helper to help make a sauce for you. Will always come back here after watching a movie.

TNovspiAyOI3m7f7I6L1fw.text: There is no better mongolian restaurant in town than YC's Mongolian Grill. From the great customer service to the tasty food and from the atmosphere to the happiness, it is an all in one restaurant. You get to choose unlimited toppings and then it is grilled and served to you as a delicious lunch or dinner. to end it off, soft serve ice cream is included! I recommend going to this outstanding restaurant for a day filled with lots of smiles and a happy tummy! And big thanks to the best manager, Ben!

NCNONwN88fDho72UhHMIJw.text: The food is absolutely amazing. You can pile your noodles super high and have food for three meals. The staff is exceptionally helpful. Ben offered to refill our drinks, and was kind enough to pack up our to go boxes. Will definitely come again.

lov6eyKmr0tLEhWe8X6MmQ.text: Ben is a legend. I've been coming here for years and he's always been positive, knowledgeable, and helpful. He encouraged me to let him make my sauce so I let him. I've been making the same sauce for like 5 years so a change was much needed. He asked me what I wanted and made a custom creation for me. Hit every flavor I was looking for perfectly. He also wrote the recipe on a card so I'd have it for next time. Outstanding service!!

m9VaAbT1xxV5TJN1mYGm9w.text: Delicious everytime I've came here. The food line is always kept clean and well restocked before any ingredients run out. The manager came around to check on us which I appreciate. Certainly the best service from any YCs location I've been to.

KUs2nQKgplHlM0widXUGXQ.text: Best Mongolian around. Restaurant is always clean and the staff are always friendly and helpful. Ben the GM leads his staff amazingly and makes this store what it is. _T7rZCLT9OFKy2-MVbobkg.text: This review is late!  We went in during our spring break (Mid April - visiting from LA) and everything was wonderful.  The friendly staff, Including Ben S. Excellent all around.  A big thank you to Ben and his team!

ubXxvX6hYrAqp_Jh3kzktw.text: We visited the Scottsdale location and I wasn't sure why Ben was so popular until I came in to visit. He greeted us, helped us as we learned how to load up our bowls and also made unique sauces adjusted to our taste preferences. He was super friendly and made sure we were happy with our selections. I ordered a large bowl and probably only ate about 1/4 of it (and I can eat!!), this is why paying for the to-go box up front comes in handy. I had enough left over for 2 more meals! I will definitely make the 2 hour trip back to Scottsdale just to eat here again - great food, great service, great prices!

yfNvJfr-8QmyJRi5iRK9Qg.text: The food is always amazing, the restaurant is always kept clean and the staff is always super nice. They remember us every time we come in, which unfortunately is not a whole lot since we don't live near by. But never disappoints we love coming in!

0fNxbtpOOAK7v7og7kRPBQ.text: By far the BEST FOOD!! Kim, Brandon, & Ben were AMAZING!!! They made sure everything was right on point!! You guys need to come in and ask Kim to make you the sauce for your food i swear she's the best sauce maker!! Brandon made sure my food was perfectly cooked!! And Ben made sure everything we got was to our liking! BEST RESTAURANT !!!

4rQNWmQ0qlyDCoxXBjSKDA.text: The service here is great. The food is delicious. The food bar is clean and well maintained. Susie was fantastic! Very kind and accommodating. She even offered water for our pup while we were sitting in the patio area! 10/10!

tQ1YwOSDcHqCuUDwbkq5QQ.text: Awesome food. Quick service and great management. Very helpful when someone like me is indecisive and has so many options to choose from!

zJ-AI2pQThzCe0vGlkulEw.text: Always a great spot for lunch or dinner. Love the options available for customization. Fast and friendly service every time I've come here. .  Which is A LOT!

rOYmUrFi1WACWaDfTRw7EA.text: Geoff,  I was C.O.O of a restaurant group with 22 locations across the US.  The difficulty was always replicating a good experience with different employees.  A good crew across the board can be tough to find.  My kids and I came back one more time (Tuesday around 2) before we flew back to Florida and once again had a really good experience.  Lorena was working the front and was friendly and helpful.  Line and cooking stations were clean and once again food was great.  Well done.

r9qaZwQZJf4WF9Xj16mJZw.text: Great customer service!! I wanted my rice fried with my meal and they were super accommodating! The staff is always around if you need help! Especially with creating your own sauce! By far the BEST Mongolian grill place I have been to! They even have patty paper to help you push down your meats and veggies to stack your bowl as high as you can!

aDCYPwOZjh-xoWZUOCDIOQ.text: I have been coming here since high school (10 years ago) and the service has always been great but this is the first time I've come back in the last four years and it was the best experience I have ever had. I have numerous allergies and I'm a vegetarian and the manager gave us amazing assistance from the spices line all the way to our table. He offered coconut aminos for my soy allergy and he had the cooks clean the stovetop because I'm vegetarian. I watched him walk around and engage with every other table along with ours in personal conversation. It was extremely amazing and you do not see service like this anywhere. High five to this entire team and what they have done to make customers happy! I will be back with all of my vegan friends and family! Cheers!

wpga5Ejd_ZeMw6CGpS48tw.text: I have been eating at this location for probably close to twenty years-whenever it first opened, although I went a good 10 years without visiting since I moved. Now that I am back in the neighborhood I have eaten here a few times. This place has really improved, I always thought it was good, and every meal and experience has been great, especially today. Elizabeth was very helpful and accommodating.  I will keep coming back and recommending to others.

berJ_aH7E64VxxXAUtBU7A.text: The manager is the coolest and ensured we had a great dinner experience. As always, food was great.

StAphESt7jlr61OdSh3mlw.text: We just had a really good lunch at YC! Thanks mostly in part due to Ellie, AKA Elizabeth! She helped make the best sauce!  She made sure everyone had what they needed. The food was delicious!

NIIFCUIDxe2lmbNE-3w1RQ.text: Friendly staff and kids are for free! Clean place and grandkids loved the free ice cream too! We will be back! Thanks for a nice relaxing experience!

d57VKU21uk0F-8On5oSTSw.text: This place was amazing. Super friendly staff. Food was fresh and so so good. Ben upfront was incredibly helpful and polite. Will definitely come back!

hITNKUrFh0p4AS3nNZfBow.text: My daughter and I travel far because we live the food but Elizabeth gave such great service today that this will be the only one we come to! She was kind and considerate and really went above and beyond!

0M8WD5cLNvKjI_OjiB4NsQ.text: All the staff were super nice & attentive while we were here. Someone even made my sauce mix! Get lots of food and it is good!

O5Jw4bqrafXiycLbuR2fPw.text: Always have a great time here. Amazing service. I drive here 30min to eat at this YCs. I love bringing people here and introducing them to YCs. I love the conversations I have and will continue to come to this one. The owner/manager is always so welcoming and great!

_XqZPh0vtBdSwpQwHB5blw.text: This was a great eating experience and the service was outstanding!  My wife is vegan and the went over and beyond to help her.

He recognizes us and always comes up to say Hi. We will continue to come here for another 25 years!

PV4ELJCTJg2KxKELr1GROg.text: Went here for the first time yesterday afternoon and was very impressed. I called ahead of time since I have food allergies & they were very informative on the phone and took the time when I got there to assure everything I was having was safe to eat. The food was absolutely delicious & the service from the time we got there until the time we left was incredible. Will definitely be coming here again!

lpXMnyujwN1T1Edp2tQoKw.text: This place is amazing !!! Large bowl, rice, soup, and frozen yogurt for under 20$  The service is amazing and the food is great. A+ in my book

M-b7vbEsyOHUYYSWshU8tw.text: This was our first trip to YC's, and I am delighted to say that it was awesome. We walked in kind of clueless and didn't know where to start, but there were 2 girls working. One was Brooklyn, and the other was Kelly. They were both so professional, but also friendly. Keep those two around. It's hard to find good customer service these days. Thanks for everything.

NI6RiWH9OQw6q8ioijwoMQ.text: I love this place! Especially this location. The manager I see every time is so nice and helpful. The food tastes great and you get a lot of food for the money you pay. I really recommend this restaurant especially this location because the staff here is especially great!

i8CqyiFD-sPMdJG1rY363A.text: I have loved this place for as long as I can remember.  I mean, I even gave it it's own nickname: Mongo.  I can always tell when amateurs are in line, because they don't quite know how to smash the meat and other ingredients down to make the largest bowl of noodle goodness as humanly possible.  I know the recipe for my favorite Mongolian sauce by heart and I will drive many miles just to taste those warm noodles.  I know there used to be a few more choices of veggies and things on the line, but after talking to a manager, he told us about their rising food cost which caused them to have to take away some of the things that were previously offered.  Hey, you gotta do what you gotta do to keep costs under control.

MeVOe35kyqOVTlMd3bDcGA.text: Had lunch today for the first time. Everything looked clean and we'll stocked. Very informative greeter and cashier.  She walked us through the process and they stir-fried one of the best lunches we have had in a while. The sauce or something must have gone bad because in less than an hour my partner and I were throwing up and VERY VERY sick. 9 hours later we have stopped throwing up but have bad headaches. I have had food poisoning many times before and this is in the top ten.

SCWCA764NRMFmqcSkJaSXA.text: Not like any other Mongolian grill. The best in the 3 states I've tried to find similar. Never the same as YCs. The Scottsdale location is the best. Staff is friendly. Down to the ice cream and soups. Everything is so good.

z-GYH_SJx0wk-___zsojcw.text: Visited YC's for lunch yesterday.  It had been years since I had been there and yes they have raised their prices but who hasn't.  It is still a good value with all that is included.  The staff was very, very helpful and the facility was very clean.  I had a delicious and healthy lunch.  I will definitely return more often.

GNLW21N7T9XqYpFFjljg_w.text: My husband and I used to live here in AZ and we would frequent YC's!  We absolutely love it. Now that we don't live here anymore, we miss it as there is nothing similar in Eastern PA where we live. Whenever we come visit, this is one of our must stop places.  I love the chef's favorite sauce, the veggies are so fresh and the rice noodles are the best!

8rIbUmFXwBk4joiMyflyfA.text: This place was awesome! You go in and select your meat, add your veggies and sauce, and they cook it right in front of you! Smash down the meat, then pile your bowl as high as you can! So fun!

UUMya3j7kQaM5sfCqYa1Zw.text: My wife has always refused to eat here, now I understand why. This could be the dirtiest place in town! Although the options appear to be healthy for the most part, I'm very concerned about the cleanliness of this establishment. We even overheard one customer saying his friend became ill the last time they ate here. The trays had grease and sauce all over them from previous customers, soup bowls had old-hard food remains in the bottom. There was food, oils, sauces and spices tossed everywhere along the food bar. I needed a shower after just walking through the food bar. My already dirty tray was again slid through more sauce and debris at the cooking station. I love food like this and can tolerate most anything, but will never come here again.

edPDd_mLwlNqNM_d6Sifiw.text: Great variety of fresh items, inexpensive, fast, efficient and friendly service! What else could you want ? A winner in my book!

pIrjg3zWS_mrMEjClVqQkA.text: Well this place isn't cheap cheap, but it's very affordable. The quality of the food is decent, however all of the meat is frozen. Really how good the food tastes is up to you, considering you essentially make it yourself. Definitely go for the unlimited pass for a dollar extra so you can make multiple creations. Yes, they have soft serve too!

UDLXqTwplfHbWCpXLEpXMw.text: I love Mongolian grills, and YC's has to be among the best I've had.  Infinite combinations of deliciousness for an extremely reasonable price, and the employees are always friendly and helpful.  Drinks are included, and so is rice, wonton noodles, and soup.  I've never left hungry, that's for sure.  I only wish they'd open one on the west side of the valley so I could eat there more often.    A great place.  Try it.

2de_DuX0CThXtLeuhUHNtw.text: Love this place everything is pretty good specially the wheat noodles and sweet n sour or teriyaki sauce. You will always end up with left over and at the end you get a nice yogurt ice cream n everything for under $15 per person.

kkkZkV5W2wagePx1PRD0bw.text: The selection of food to put in with your noodles is really great.  We were greeted by Katie, who walked us thru the process.  Food was really really good.  And I loved that I could personalize everything.  Passion iced tea was really tasty too.  While we were eating, we were within earshot of Katie.  She was clearing tables, helping customers with questions, and running around with many jobs.  She was very busy and kept a smile on her face the whole time.  She just had a great attitude and was very knowledgeable about pretty much everything!!  We had a great lunch, but even better service

bero-OWYD18GiDqWjV6P4Q.text: It's been a while since we've been here so when we came in Sunday for lunch our expectations were high since we've been craving it for so long.   It wasn't crazy busy which was nice, I hate waiting behind people.   The vegetables were fresh and well stocked. Instead of creating my own sauce I decided to just follow the board, I'm not good at direction but the Spicy Thai was wonderful. My biggest problem was the chicken, it tasted like jerky.   We'll be back but next time sticking to a vegetarian lunch!

CO3RfsnJ9cqdDoH9gmyE7A.text: The management of YC's Grill did take the feedback well and offered us another chance to visit them.  The feel was much better compared to our previous experience with them and hope they keep it up! Great food choices, meats, veggies, carbs, sauces..turns out into delicious combinations.   They have earned our business again!

O-esmZzYas_mk1Xrs-5cfA.text: It cost $13 per person ($12.50meal $.50 To-Go Box) Great bang for buck! You get a bowl and literally stuff it until you have a big mountain. You then put your sauce in a separate bowl (use the recipes they have listed!) Then give it to the guy to cook it for you (takes about 5min) I'd strongly suggest to either use 2 sauce recipes, or double the recipe you have Once you get you're bowl back you will notice your food shrunk in half It will still be way more than you can probably eat Just in case it's not enough food, your order comes with unlimited rice, soup, chips, soft drink, and cheap yogurt you want! :)  Tips: Use the wax paper to squish all the food possible into your bowl!!! Look at the people around you if you feel at all lost (really helped me) They only charge $.50 for a To-Go Box because people could easily fill a box with some of the unlimited rice or chips if they wanted to. (please don't do it though)  Everyone here was extremely friendly. Even the cooks said hello to me! This is an excellent spot if you want to show somebody you know of a small unique restaurant (like on a date with an outgoing girl, or a guy that enjoys eating a ton)!!! Me and my girlfriend would love to come once a month but it's a little too far for us.  Don't come if: You hate buffet style restaurants It's a Saturday night and you hate awesome car shows (parking lot) You're a picky eater that doesn't like getting their food squished together You only plan on eating a little

I-hAZ6vymMORF7U-zogRqA.text: Haven't been here since I was 12 (29 now) and I  can't believe it's still open and still amazing. The cashier, Maria, was so polite and had the most amazing customer service. She was right there to help everyone, even with sauce options. She's a gem, keep her. Very happy to be back :)

BcDKMlF3hPn21UR1uxu_7g.text: Tasty. Great healthy options. The hostess was delightful and extremely helpful. I went in for lunch, got the large and had enough leftover for dinner. I wish it was closer to home, but will be back when I'm in the area.

R5XQU27dcvjUzE_gwNV7Cg.text: My boyfriend brought me here almost 2-3 years ago, and since the first time, we've visited this location many, many times. It's a great place to go when you want a filling, healthy meal for lunch.  I've always been a fan of DIY/Cook it yourself places. (I.E. Korean BBQ and Hot pots.)  I usually try stuffing as many ingredients into the bowl, sometimes it requires punching down the frozen slices of meat you first throw in. And you have to get a lot of sauce otherwise you're not going to taste anything. When I first came here I had no idea on what sauce combinations to use, its nice they put up a sign above the grill so anyone new to YC's can start out from and branch out adding different combos.

d_K3_ipM0XeaqOQXh91DwQ.text: I love, love, love this place!  Just be careful about hostess doing your sauce and putting ladles and ladles of oil on it.  For some, the draw to eat here is to try to eat clean, lower fat meals.  I only tried lunch yesterday but plan to go back today for dinner!!!! Super Ono!!!!

3PlhMt032yYBomAXG81stg.text: I was here for a Sunday dinner. Price to value, this place easily deserves five stars. For $13, you get to choose your ingredients to make your own custom noodle, hot soup, free soft drinks and two flavors of ice cream.   It is best if you read some of the reviews here before going to the restaurant so that you know what and how to pick and how to make your noodle because it can be pretty overwhelming for newbies.   Don't be afraid to load up your bowl-- Meat (Chicken, Pork, Beef, Fish), Veggies and 3 types of noodles. When it comes to choose sauces, just look up and read up the flavors to get some guidance. IMPO, sticking with a pre-defined flavor is a good idea than just randomly mixing a whole lot of sauces. It is going to be a lot of food, so plenty of leftover to take home as well.  Tip the cooks near the grill and enjoy!!

mOq4lhOE93KRdyUi-0-Kuw.text: My biggest tip for newbies to YC's, look toward the grill and look up.  There you will find a nice little menu of sauce formulas.  Unfortunately, I never looked up.  As a result, I didn't have enough sauce.  In my case, that was a good thing because the sauce I did have tasted like crap, so more of the same would have been even crappier.  As for the ingredients, lots of choices with fresh veggies.  I have to say the meat looked unappetizing to me.  In fact, I had to ask my husband what the hell it was.  I guess it's a good thing you don't see piles of freshly sliced meat, else it might not be so fresh after all.  But in its frozen to minus 500 degrees F state, I found I opted for more veggies.  Two sizes available.  I went with the large, crammed my bowl full until it resembled a small mountain, and then wasted over half of it.  So get the small unless you want leftovers or you haven't eaten in several days.

hsaudESlrASUdUkEZ_cEqw.text: I was really impressed by the friendliness of the staff and the selection of proteins and veggies! The part that didn't work so well? The sauces. Many were hard to get to and even harder to dip due to the height of the containers and the sneeze proof glass. I made a total mess (but I cleaned it up too!)Anyway, I didn't follow the "sauce guidelines" listed on the wall and just went rogue. This wasnlt a good idea. I ended up with a really bland, soupy mess. TGFS (thank goodness for siracha) or this would have been a big waste. The meat fish and veggies were great, but I made the mistake of adding wheat noodles- BLECH! No taste and kinda gummy-kinda hard.     I would go back and stick with meat and veg and follow directions on the sauce cuz this place is clean and could be both healthy and tasty if done the right way.

Or6TevGupnm6b1NsZpMsDQ.text: Since I am an avid fan of the pavillions car show I go to ycs and have for over 6 yrs.  let me explain why you see an update from 6 months or a year ago the and one from 6 months before that.   I've been involve in the restaurant industry for more than 10 years in one capacity or another.  I also have been trained in the old school French ssicsl fine dining so I know a little about more than just being a foody.      You don't go to ycs  for a sit down dining type abiance. It is the food yet also everything that incorporates good fun and a great Experiance.    Servers?  Well not exactically,  but they will help you make decisions based on what you tell them you like in flavoreds or spices they aren't afraid to point you in a direction it's your choice to take it.      The food is cold and fresh and dated on the Cambros they use for storage.  They will scrape the circular grill if requested and usually do on a repeats basis.  Stack the food high and lots.   It will shrink as cooked. But Personally I use a small soup bowl for my ladles of sauces.   I have never been disappointed with any other people here.   Employees and guests alike.  Good food.  Fun atmosphere and above all else.  Consistancy.  Good.  Logistically you Don't have a place they does the business they do with out being above average.  There's just to many other restaurants to go to in the area if the wee just average  I see reviews here like..its too loud.  Not healthy etc.  yes moderation is the key.  Case and points. I will sometime's not use any sauces or noodles.  I pile on chx and spinach and veg with some ginger and garlic and it's awesome and for 10.00 I can eat for two days.

v5xLGm66w6wWcyv5fRY1pA.text: I love this place and have been going for years, but last Sunday they asked me before I paid the bill if I wanted to include a tip for the cook who prepares my food.... seriously?

nKdnPLfIIG9C8nBpZN6iVA.text: Our first visit was amazing! The gal at the cash register made sure we knew they wanted us to fill our bowls to the brim, unlike most Mongolian eateries. She further helped us with the sauces, making sure we had the flavor we wanted. Additionally, we observed the manager sweeping the floor, assisting customers and interacting with customers and his employees in such a way, that it was clear the employees were a team... They seemed to love their work... Which spills over into a welcome overall environment! Good food, healthy, tasty...upbeat! Great lunch. Thanks!

HPMV8kGh9fU4jztxlGV2yA.text: I LOVE YC's! I like the fact that you can choose if you want to be super healthy with veggies and tofu or go and pig out on meat and noodles. YCs is never disappointing and is now located by a fro yo place so win-win!

z1hxypQrjcuk6tszu5ztMA.text: I love this place. I've been coming here for years. The variety of meats, veggies, spices, and sauces are excellent. The drinks are included in the price of each bowl. The staff have always been friendly and I have never had a bad experience here. I moved to another state and I look forward to having lunch/dinner at YC's when we come to visit.

ZH4hcnHx1u7HYkdPE-IWag.text: It doesn't matter who you are, who you're with or what you eat. This place is delish. No matter if you are suffering from heartbreak or new found love nothing can fill that gaping void inside like an overload of veggies, meat and noodles....and meat. Meat.

IkVRIwRMZR8VzlFCuqqpcw.text: My husband and I ate here after the car show last weekend.  The concept is part fun, part weird: watching them cook your food = fun. Trying to concoct your own meal, complete with spices, sauces, oils and "squishing" = a little weird.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. They explained the "squish" concept when I told them I was a first timer, and there was a helpful gentleman at the end of the line to help me make up a sauce.  I was weirded out by the shaved, frozen meat. It makes sense that they need to keep it this way (frozen to maintain safety, shaved thin to cook fast), but it is still a bizarre sight and I was hesitant to use it. All the veggies were super fresh, so I loaded up on those.  All you can eat soup, wontons, rice and soft serve. I was disappointed that the soups were so basic (chicken noodle and beef vegetable? How about some egg drop!?) The wontons were ok and the soft serve was meh. Didn't bother with the rice.  My problem was that, at the end of it all, I had a large bowl of not-that-great stir fry. How many times do you need to experiment until you find a sauce/spice/oil/cooking wine ratio that actually tastes good? THIS IS WHY I EAT OUT, PEOPLE....so I can get a guaranteed yummy meal, not take my chances!  And as another review stated, it is super odd to go down this buffet line watching people pile, stuff and cram food into these bowls, trying to get every last ounce of their money's worth. Yes, it shrinks a little while cooking, I'm sure. But people were acting like animals with the wax paper and extra bowls, using their entire body weight to smoosh their own food. Not an appetizing sight.  I might be willing to give it one more shot with another sauce compilation, but after that I think I'm done.

6mP05543ww_-zk_m_MZ-GA.text: Ate at this restaurant Saturday november 14 and had my leftovers on Sunday november 15. Tuesday morning I woke up violently ill and could not hold in food or fluids all day tuesday.   Went to the urgent care tuesday evening and they promptly sent me to the ER to be treated for severe dehydration caused by "probably a food borne bacteria." I just finished my three day antibiotic course and am feeling much better, but now that I have had time to look at the facts and speak with the Maricopa County Department of Health, I can confidently say that my horrific three days of food poisoning were undoubtedly caused by YC's Mongolian Grill.  The fact that I was told someone else got a case of E.Coli with bloody stools just about a week before my poisoning really shored it up for me. YC's is apparently serving tainted or contaminated food. I would not recommend eating at this establishment. I must also make it clear that my noodles which I took home were transported from the restaurant to my refrigerator (20 minutes) and kept in the refrigerator until they were microwaved and consumed.

R1dbHvqxwhrTg2MzW848-A.text: I love this mongolian bbq...its my favorite one in arizona.  I have tried others and they never have the good variety of veggies, proteins or sauces like this place has...I do the combination everytime...I have tried other sauce combos and I always go back to my original way...I love to add the chili oil because I love spice...then I get some of the wontons.and dip them in siracha and hot mustard...yum yum yum...dont forget to use the wheat noodles they are the best!!! Always put extra sauce because your meal will come out dry if you dont.  They have rice and soup too, but I never get it because you get so much food! You get to have frozen yogurt after and its perfect because you get a little sweet at the end.  I love it...i just wish it were closer to my house but I will make the drive...

75VGEFW8sbmF8vMx-k_l0g.text: Tuesday night and you don't feel like cooking? Head over to YC's.. fresh and tasty on the cheap! It's so much fun to because YOU control almost every aspect of your bowl.. mine is usually so full its toppling onto the tray.. there are just enough choices to keep me interested in coming back next time thinking, I wonder how that'll taste?!

1JveA_YUERyKQm-8uJ18oA.text: I can't really hype about YC's. It's good, and I'll hand them that, but it's not a 4-5 star place you should take a date. It's build your own meal and have some hispanic men with sticks toss it around a hot circle.   The meat is so thinly shaven that once it cooks down it's like digging through to find a needle in a hay stack to find it. They do have TOFU for all you veggie heads out there, but I wouldn't trust the grill they toss it around on. It's not like they clean it after every use. Plus who knows what's in the sauces.  The noodles you can load on like no other. As you stand in line, you will see people building their food dome. Pretty self explanatory.  The noodles are awesome thick chewy. -Definitely- ask for a to-go box upon ordering, unless you really think you can finish that mother load of carbs. This stuff is better as leftovers anyway. Way worth the 50 cents.   Soup is just okay, but you gotta love those addictive fried won-tons. I love grease. You can feel the grease smash back out of them when you bite into the crispy shell. Again, you can get as many as you want. Same with a bucket of brown and white rice they have for serve.  During dinner hours they allow you to have free self serve/soft serve frozen yogurt from their machines. The cones are junk. Nasty cardboard like cones, and the frozen yogurt is VERY "so so". Not worth it if you ask me.   Even though they have tons of great perks, it's still just a place to get stuffed on cheap food. Lunch $8, Dinner $10.

9kvUklO2zw-ZAEhUKT4kkg.text: It has been several months but I hadn't lost the formula (80/10/10 - veggies, meat, noodles).  Pat down some chicken-turkey (no taste difference as far as I can tell) with the wax paper.  Load up with mostly veggies (more green than red or white), add some wheat noodles to fill the bowl to the brim.  Follow with the sweet and sour mix but add some extra vinegar and orange sauce.  Add some pineapple and all set to have it grilled.  Fill a small bowl with peanuts and another small bowl with pineapple.  Fill the large red plastic drinking vessel with ice and low cal lemonade.  Then chow down...  My formula has more or less stayed the same since being introduced to YC's by Mike T and/or Erik T.  Both took different approaches and none tasted like the other despite selecting choices from the same line.  Amazing how three related people ended up with very different meals especially Erik T with cod fish and Mike T with who knows what kind of sauces except they were very dark.

8D2Afn3LOthd1ggea4YCUg.text: Love this place... Great price, great food!! I mostly love it because it can be very healthy if you be careful with the sauces...

1BI4jNxPmSs2gnhBLjITIg.text: YC's is great food.  You get to fill up your bowl with all the ingredients you like and watch it be cooked right in front of you.  The ingredients are always fresh and there is a wide variety of sauces.  Good meal for vegans, plus the soft-serve is vegetarian too!

nzDcM4nHoU-dKE5Wbedr7w.text: My parents would love this place. What I mean by that is that they live in a small town, so the build your own, watch them cook it is something different than what's offered in smaller towns.  For me, it was fun the first time. The second time, there's really nothing special about it. Take your big appetite friends, it's a good value for the amount of food you can have made.
